title.raw: 《魯周公世家》 House of Lu Zhougong

sentences.zh: 周公旦者，周武王弟也。

translations.literal: Duke of Zhou Dan, Zhou Wu Wang younger brother.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou Dan was the younger brother of King Wu of Zhou.

sentences.zh: 自文王在時，旦為子孝，篤仁，異於群子。

translations.literal: From Wen Wang alive time, Dan as son filial, sincere benevolent, different from group sons.
translations.idiomatic: Even during King Wen's lifetime, Dan was exceptionally filial as a son, sincerely benevolent, and distinguished from his brothers.

sentences.zh: 及武王即位，旦常輔翼武王，用事居多。

translations.literal: And Wu Wang ascended throne, Dan constantly assisted protected Wu Wang, handled affairs most.
translations.idiomatic: After King Wu ascended the throne, Dan constantly assisted and protected him, and handled most of the affairs of state.

sentences.zh: 武王九年，東伐至盟津，周公輔行。

translations.literal: Wu Wang ninth year, east attacked reached Meng Jin, Duke of Zhou assisted went.
translations.idiomatic: In King Wu's ninth year, during the eastern campaign that reached Mengjin, the Duke of Zhou assisted with the expedition.

sentences.zh: 十一年，伐紂，至牧野，周公佐武王，作牧誓。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, attacked Zhou, reached Mu Ye, Duke of Zhou assisted Wu Wang, composed Mu oath.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, they attacked Zhou and reached Muye. The Duke of Zhou assisted King Wu and composed the Oath of Mu.

sentences.zh: 破殷，入商宮。

translations.literal: Defeated Yin, entered Shang palace.
translations.idiomatic: They defeated Yin and entered the Shang palace.

sentences.zh: 已殺紂，周公把大鉞，召公把小鉞，以夾武王，釁社，告紂之罪于天，及殷民。

translations.literal: Already killed Zhou, Duke of Zhou held great axe, Duke Shao held small axe, to flank Wu Wang, smeared altar, reported Zhou crimes to heaven, and Yin people.
translations.idiomatic: After killing Zhou, the Duke of Zhou held the great axe, and Duke Shao held the small axe, flanking King Wu. They smeared blood on the altar and proclaimed Zhou's crimes to heaven and the Yin people.

sentences.zh: 釋箕子之囚。

translations.literal: Released Ji Zi prison.
translations.idiomatic: They released Jizi from prison.

sentences.zh: 封紂子武庚祿父，使管叔、蔡叔傅之，以續殷祀。

translations.literal: Enfeoffed Zhou son Wu Geng Lu Fu, made Guan Shu, Cai Shu tutor him, to continue Yin sacrifices.
translations.idiomatic: They enfeoffed Zhou's son Wu Geng Lufu, and made Guan Shu and Cai Shu tutor him, to continue the Yin sacrifices.

sentences.zh: 遍封功臣同姓戚者。

translations.literal: Extensively enfeoffed meritorious officials same surname relatives.
translations.idiomatic: They extensively enfeoffed meritorious officials and same-surname relatives.

sentences.zh: 封周公旦於少昊之虛曲阜，是為魯公。

translations.literal: Enfeoffed Duke of Zhou Dan at Shao Hao ancient site Qu Fu, this was Lu Gong.
translations.idiomatic: They enfeoffed the Duke of Zhou Dan at Shaohao's ancient site in Qufu. This was the Duke of Lu.

sentences.zh: 周公不就封，留佐武王。

translations.literal: Duke of Zhou not went enfeoffment, remained assisted Wu Wang.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou did not go to his enfeoffment, but remained to assist King Wu.

sentences.zh: 武王克殷二年，天下未集，武王有疾，不豫，群臣懼，太公、召公乃繆卜。

translations.literal: Wu Wang conquered Yin second year, world not yet gathered, Wu Wang had illness, not cheerful, group ministers feared, Tai Gong, Shao Gong then false divined.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year after King Wu conquered Yin, the world was not yet pacified. King Wu fell ill and was not cheerful. The ministers were fearful, so the Grand Duke and Duke Shao performed false divinations.

sentences.zh: 周公曰：「未可以戚我先王。」

translations.literal: Duke of Zhou said: 'Not yet can grieve our former kings.'
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou said: 'One cannot yet grieve our former kings.'

sentences.zh: 周公於是乃自以為質，設三壇，周公北面立，戴璧秉圭，告于太王、王季、文王。

translations.literal: Duke of Zhou therefore then self took as pledge, set up three altars, Duke of Zhou north faced stood, wore jade disk held jade tablet, reported to Tai Wang, Wang Ji, Wen Wang.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou therefore offered himself as pledge, setting up three altars. The Duke of Zhou stood facing north, wearing a jade disk and holding a jade tablet, and informed King Tai, King Ji, and King Wen.

sentences.zh: 史策祝曰：「惟爾元孫王發，勤勞阻疾。

translations.literal: Scribe bamboo slips prayed said: 'Only your eldest grandson Wang Fa, laborious difficult illness.
translations.idiomatic: The scribe's bamboo slips read in prayer: 'Your eldest grandson King Fa has labored with difficulty and illness.

sentences.zh: 若爾三王是有負子之責於天，以旦代王發之身。

translations.literal: If you three kings have bear son responsibility to heaven, use Dan substitute Wang Fa body.
translations.idiomatic: If you three kings bear responsibility for your son to heaven, let Dan substitute for the body of King Fa.

sentences.zh: 旦巧能，多材多藝，能事鬼神。

translations.literal: Dan skillful able, many talents many arts, able serve ghosts spirits.
translations.idiomatic: Dan is skillful and able, with many talents and arts, and is able to serve the ghosts and spirits.

sentences.zh: 乃王發不如旦多材多藝，不能事鬼神。

translations.literal: But Wang Fa not equal Dan many talents many arts, not able serve ghosts spirits.
translations.idiomatic: But King Fa is not equal to Dan in many talents and arts, and cannot serve the ghosts and spirits.

sentences.zh: 乃命于帝庭，敷佑四方，用能定汝子孫于下地，四方之民罔不敬畏。

translations.literal: Then commanded at Di court, spread aid four directions, use able settle your descendants at below earth, four directions people none not respectful fearful.
translations.idiomatic: Heaven commanded at the imperial court, spreading aid to the four directions, thereby able to settle your descendants on the earth below. The people of the four directions, none are not respectful and fearful.

sentences.zh: 無墜天之降葆命，我先王亦永有所依歸。

translations.literal: Not fall heaven descended protecting mandate, our former kings also eternally have something depend return.
translations.idiomatic: Do not let fall the heaven's descended protecting mandate. Our former kings will also eternally have somewhere to depend and return.

sentences.zh: 今我其即命於元龜，爾之許我，我以其璧與圭歸，以俟爾命。

translations.literal: Now I then immediately command at great turtle, you permit me, I use jade disk and tablet return, to await your command.
translations.idiomatic: Now I will immediately divine with the great turtle. If you permit me, I will return with the jade disk and tablet to await your command.

sentences.zh: 爾不許我，我乃屏璧與圭。」

translations.literal: You not permit me, I then discard jade disk and tablet.'
translations.idiomatic: If you do not permit me, I will then discard the jade disk and tablet.'

sentences.zh: 周公已令史策告太王、王季、文王，欲代武王發，於是乃即三王而卜。

translations.literal: Duke of Zhou already ordered scribe bamboo slips reported Tai Wang, Wang Ji, Wen Wang, wanted substitute Wu Wang Fa, therefore then approached three kings and divined.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou had already ordered the scribe to inform King Tai, King Ji, and King Wen on the bamboo slips of his wish to substitute for King Wu Fa. He then approached the three kings and performed divination.

sentences.zh: 卜人皆曰吉，發書視之，信吉。

translations.literal: Diviners all said auspicious, opened slips viewed them, truly auspicious.
translations.idiomatic: All the diviners said it was auspicious. When they opened the slips and viewed them, it was truly auspicious.

sentences.zh: 周公喜，開籥，乃見書遇吉。

translations.literal: Duke of Zhou happy, opened chest, then saw slips encountered auspicious.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou was happy. When he opened the chest, he saw that the slips had encountered auspicious omens.

sentences.zh: 周公入賀武王曰：「王其無害。

translations.literal: Duke of Zhou entered congratulated Wu Wang said: 'Wang then no harm.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou entered and congratulated King Wu, saying: 'Your Majesty will be unharmed.

sentences.zh: 旦新受命三王，維長終是圖。

translations.literal: Dan newly received command three kings, only long completion this plan.
translations.idiomatic: Dan has newly received the command of the three kings, planning only for long-term completion.

sentences.zh: 茲道能念予一人。」

translations.literal: This way able consider me one person.'
translations.idiomatic: This way can you consider me, this one person.'

sentences.zh: 周公藏其策金縢匱中，誡守者勿敢言。

translations.literal: Duke of Zhou hid his slips gold wrapped chest middle, warned guards not dare speak.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou hid the slips in a gold-wrapped box and warned the guardians not to dare speak of it.

sentences.zh: 明日，武王有瘳。

translations.literal: Next day, Wu Wang had recovery.
translations.idiomatic: The next day, King Wu recovered.

sentences.zh: 其後武王既崩，成王少，在彊葆之中。

translations.literal: After this Wu Wang already died, Cheng Wang young, in strong protection middle.
translations.idiomatic: After this, King Wu died. King Cheng was young and was in the swaddling clothes.

sentences.zh: 周公恐天下聞武王崩而畔，周公乃踐阼代成王攝行政當國。

translations.literal: Duke of Zhou feared world heard Wu Wang died and rebelled, Duke of Zhou then stepped throne substituted Cheng Wang administered government governed state.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou feared that if the world heard of King Wu's death they would rebel. The Duke of Zhou therefore ascended the throne and substituted for King Cheng, administering the government and governing the state.

sentences.zh: 管叔及其群弟流言於國曰：「周公將不利於成王。」

translations.literal: Guan Shu and his group younger brothers spread words in state said: 'Duke of Zhou will not benefit Cheng Wang.'
translations.idiomatic: Guan Shu and his brothers spread rumors throughout the state, saying: 'The Duke of Zhou will bring harm to King Cheng.'

sentences.zh: 周公乃告太公望、召公奭曰：「我之所以弗辟而攝行政者，恐天下畔周，無以告我先王太王、王季、文王。

translations.literal: Duke of Zhou then told Tai Gong Wang, Shao Gong Shi said: 'I reason not withdraw and administered government, feared world rebelled Zhou, nothing to report our former kings Tai Wang, Wang Ji, Wen Wang.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou then informed the Grand Duke Wang and Duke Shao Shi, saying: 'The reason I do not withdraw but administer the government is that I fear the world will revolt against Zhou, and I will have nothing with which to report to my former kings King Tai, King Ji, and King Wen.

sentences.zh: 三王之憂勞天下久矣，於今而后成。

translations.literal: Three kings worried toiled world long already, at now then after accomplished.
translations.idiomatic: The three kings have long worried and toiled for the world. Only now can it be accomplished.

sentences.zh: 武王蚤終，成王少，將以成周，我所以為之若此。」

translations.literal: Wu Wang early ended, Cheng Wang young, about to use accomplish Zhou, I reason did it like this.'
translations.idiomatic: King Wu died prematurely. King Cheng is young. He will accomplish the Zhou enterprise. This is why I do it like this.'

sentences.zh: 於是卒相成王，而使其子伯禽代就封於魯。

translations.literal: Therefore finally assisted Cheng Wang, and sent his son Bo Qin substitute went enfeoffment at Lu.
translations.idiomatic: He therefore continued to assist King Cheng, and sent his son Bo Qin to accept the enfeoffment at Lu in his place.

sentences.zh: 周公戒伯禽曰：「我文王之子，武王之弟，成王之叔父，我於天下亦不賤矣。

translations.literal: Duke of Zhou admonished Bo Qin said: 'I Wen Wang son, Wu Wang younger brother, Cheng Wang uncle, I at world also not base.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou admonished Bo Qin, saying: 'I am King Wen's son, King Wu's younger brother, King Cheng's uncle. I am not lowly in the world.

sentences.zh: 然我一沐三捉發，一飯三吐哺，起以待士，猶恐失天下之賢人。

translations.literal: But I one bath three grasped hair, one meal three spat food, rose to receive scholars, still feared lose world worthy men.
translations.idiomatic: Yet I, once bathing, thrice grasp my hair; once eating, thrice spit out my food; rise to receive scholars, still fearing to lose the world's worthy men.

sentences.zh: 子之魯，慎無以國驕人。」

translations.literal: You go Lu, careful not use state arrogant people.'
translations.idiomatic: When you go to Lu, be careful not to be arrogant because of your state.'

sentences.zh: 管、蔡、武庚等果率淮夷而反。

translations.literal: Guan, Cai, Wu Geng and others indeed led Huai barbarians and rebelled.
translations.idiomatic: Guan Shu, Cai Shu, Wu Geng, and others indeed led the Huai barbarians and rebelled.

sentences.zh: 周公乃奉成王命，興師東伐，作大誥。

translations.literal: Duke of Zhou then received Cheng Wang command, raised troops east attacked, composed Great Announcement.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou then received King Cheng's command, raised troops for an eastern campaign, and composed the Great Announcement.

sentences.zh: 遂誅管叔，殺武庚，放蔡叔。

translations.literal: Then executed Guan Shu, killed Wu Geng, exiled Cai Shu.
translations.idiomatic: He then executed Guan Shu, killed Wu Geng, and exiled Cai Shu.

sentences.zh: 收殷餘民，以封康叔於衛，封微子於宋，以奉殷祀。

translations.literal: Gathered Yin remaining people, to enfeoff Kang Shu at Wei, enfeoffed Wei Zi at Song, to continue Yin sacrifices.
translations.idiomatic: He gathered the remaining Yin people, enfeoffed Kang Shu at Wei, enfeoffed Wei Zi at Song, to continue the Yin sacrifices.

sentences.zh: 寧淮夷東土，二年而畢定。

translations.literal: Pacified Huai barbarians east lands, two years and completely settled.
translations.idiomatic: He pacified the Huai barbarians in the eastern lands. In two years it was completely settled.

sentences.zh: 諸侯咸服宗周。

translations.literal: Feudal lords all submitted revered Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: All the feudal lords submitted to and revered Zhou.

sentences.zh: 天降祉福，唐叔得禾，異母同穎，獻之成王，成王命唐叔以餽周公於東土，作餽禾。

translations.literal: Heaven descended blessings fortune, Tang Shu obtained grain, different root same ear, presented it Cheng Wang, Cheng Wang ordered Tang Shu to present Duke of Zhou at east lands, composed Presentation Grain.
translations.idiomatic: Heaven sent down blessings and good fortune. Tang Shu obtained grain with two stalks from one root and the same ear. He presented it to King Cheng. King Cheng ordered Tang Shu to present it as a gift to the Duke of Zhou in the eastern lands, composing the Presentation of Grain.

sentences.zh: 周公既受命禾，嘉天子命，作嘉禾。

translations.literal: Duke of Zhou already received commanded grain, praised Son of Heaven command, composed Praising Grain.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou having received the commanded grain, praised the Son of Heaven's command, and composed the Praising Grain.

sentences.zh: 東土以集，周公歸報成王，乃為詩貽王，命之曰鴟鸮。

translations.literal: East lands with gathered, Duke of Zhou returned reported Cheng Wang, then made poem presented king, named it Owl.
translations.idiomatic: The eastern lands being gathered, the Duke of Zhou returned and reported to King Cheng. He then made a poem to present to the king, naming it the Owl.

sentences.zh: 王亦未敢訓周公。

translations.literal: King also not yet dared rebuke Duke of Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: The king also did not yet dare to rebuke the Duke of Zhou.

sentences.zh: 成王七年二月乙未，王朝步自周，至豐，使太保召公先之雒相土。

translations.literal: Cheng Wang seventh year second month Yi Wei, king court walked from Zhou, reached Feng, sent Grand Protector Shao Gong first went Luo surveyed land.
translations.idiomatic: In King Cheng's seventh year, on the day Yi Wei of the second month, the king walked from morning court at Zhou to Feng, sending the Grand Protector Duke Shao ahead to Luo to survey the land.

sentences.zh: 其三月，周公往營成周雒邑，卜居焉，曰吉，遂國之。

translations.literal: That third month, Duke of Zhou went planned Cheng Zhou Luo Yi, divined resided there, said auspicious, then established capital there.
translations.idiomatic: In the third month, the Duke of Zhou went to plan Chengzhou Luoyi, divined about residing there, said it was auspicious, and so established the capital there.

sentences.zh: 成王長，能聽政。

translations.literal: Cheng Wang grew, able listened government.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng grew up and could listen to government.

sentences.zh: 於是周公乃還政於成王，成王臨朝。

translations.literal: Therefore Duke of Zhou then returned government to Cheng Wang, Cheng Wang approached court.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the Duke of Zhou then returned the government to King Cheng, and King Cheng held court.

sentences.zh: 周公之代成王治，南面倍依以朝諸侯。

translations.literal: Duke of Zhou substituting Cheng Wang governed, south faced leaned armrest to received feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou substituting for King Cheng in governing, faced south and leaned on the armrest to receive the feudal lords in audience.

sentences.zh: 及七年後，還政成王，北面就臣位，匔匔如畏然。

translations.literal: And seven years after, returned government Cheng Wang, north faced took minister position, trembling like fearful thus.
translations.idiomatic: When seven years had passed, he returned the government to King Cheng, faced north and took his position as minister, trembling as if in fear.

sentences.zh: 初，成王少時，病，周公乃自揃其蚤沈之河，以祝於神曰：「王少未有識，奸神命者乃旦也。」

translations.literal: Initially, Cheng Wang young time, ill, Duke of Zhou then self cut his fingernails sank them river, to prayed to spirits said: 'Wang young not yet had discernment, violated spirits command then Dan.'
translations.idiomatic: Initially, when King Cheng was young and ill, the Duke of Zhou cut his own fingernails and sank them in the river, praying to the spirits: 'The king is young and has no discernment. The one who violates the spirits' command is Dan.'

sentences.zh: 亦藏其策於府。

translations.literal: Also hid his slips at treasury.
translations.idiomatic: He also hid the prayer slips in the treasury.

sentences.zh: 成王病有瘳。

translations.literal: Cheng Wang illness had recovery.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng's illness improved.

sentences.zh: 及成王用事，人或譖周公，周公奔楚。

translations.literal: And Cheng Wang handled affairs, someone slandered Duke of Zhou, Duke of Zhou fled Chu.
translations.idiomatic: When King Cheng took charge of affairs, someone slandered the Duke of Zhou, and the Duke of Zhou fled to Chu.

sentences.zh: 成王發府，見周公禱書，乃泣，反周公。

translations.literal: Cheng Wang opened treasury, saw Duke of Zhou prayer slips, then wept, recalled Duke of Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng opened the treasury and saw the Duke of Zhou's prayer slips, then wept and recalled the Duke of Zhou.

sentences.zh: 周公歸，恐成王壯，治有所淫佚，乃作多士，作毋逸。

translations.literal: Duke of Zhou returned, feared Cheng Wang mature, governance had something licentious dissipated, then composed Many Officers, composed Do Not Indulge.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou returned, fearing that when King Cheng matured, his governance might become indulgent and dissipated, and so composed the Many Officers and composed the Do Not Indulge.

sentences.zh: 毋逸稱：「為人父母，為業至長久，子孫驕奢忘之，以亡其家，為人子可不慎乎！

translations.literal: Do Not Indulge stated: 'As people parents, as enterprise extremely long lasting, descendants arrogant extravagant forgot it, to destroy their families, as people sons can not careful?
translations.idiomatic: The Do Not Indulge states: 'As parents of the people, the enterprise is exceedingly long-lasting. Descendants become arrogant and extravagant and forget it, thus destroying their families. As children of such parents, can we not be careful?

sentences.zh: 笔昔在殷王中宗，嚴恭敬畏天命，自度治民，震懼不敢荒寧，故中宗饗國七十五年。

translations.literal: Past at Yin Wang Zhong Zong, strict respectful feared heaven mandate, self measured governed people, trembled feared not dared neglect rest, therefore Zhong Zong enjoyed state seventy-five years.
translations.idiomatic: In the past, under Yin King Zhong Zong, he was strict, respectful, and feared heaven's mandate. He measured himself in governing the people, trembling and not daring to neglect his duties, therefore Zhong Zong enjoyed the state for seventy-five years.

sentences.zh: 其在高宗，久勞于外，為與小人，作其即位，乃有亮闇，三年不言，言乃讙，不敢荒寧，密靖殷國，至于小大無怨，故高宗饗國五十五年。

translations.literal: At Gao Zong, long toiled at outside, lived with small people, when he ascended throne, then had bright dark, three years not spoke, spoke then thunderous, not dared neglect rest, quietly pacified Yin state, reached small great no complaint, therefore Gao Zong enjoyed state fifty-five years.
translations.idiomatic: As for Gao Zong, he long toiled abroad, living with commoners. When he ascended the throne, he had a period of mourning silence, three years without speaking. When he spoke, it was thunderous. He did not dare neglect his duties, quietly pacifying Yin, so that from great to small none complained. Therefore Gao Zong enjoyed the state for fifty-five years.

sentences.zh: 其在祖甲，不義惟王，久為小人于外，知小人之依，能保施小民，不侮寡，故祖甲饗國三十三年。」

translations.literal: At Zu Jia, not righteous only king, long served as small people at outside, knew small people dependence, able protect benefit small people, not insulted orphaned, therefore Zu Jia enjoyed state thirty-three years.'
translations.idiomatic: As for Zu Jia, he was not righteous only as king, long serving as a commoner abroad. He understood the commoners' dependence, could protect and benefit the small people, not insulting the orphaned. Therefore Zu Jia enjoyed the state for thirty-three years.'

sentences.zh: 多士稱曰：「自湯至于帝乙，無不率祀明德，帝無不配天者。

translations.literal: Many Officers stated said: 'From Tang reached Di Yi, none not followed sacrifices illuminated virtue, emperors none not matched heaven.
translations.idiomatic: The Many Officers states: 'From Tang to Di Yi, none failed to follow the sacrifices and illuminate virtue. None of the emperors failed to match heaven.

sentences.zh: 在今後嗣王紂，誕淫厥佚，不顧天及民之從也。

translations.literal: At now later successor king Zhou, greatly licentious his dissipation, not considered heaven and people obedience.
translations.idiomatic: As for the present successor king Zhou, he greatly indulged in licentiousness and dissipation, not considering heaven and the people's obedience.

sentences.zh: 其民皆可誅。」

translations.literal: His people all could be executed.'
translations.idiomatic: All his people could be executed.'

sentences.zh: （周多士）「文王日中昃不暇食，饗國五十年。」

translations.literal: (Zhou Many Officers) 'Wen Wang noon sun declined not leisure eat, enjoyed state fifty years.'
translations.idiomatic: (The Many Officers of Zhou) 'King Wen, even when the sun declined at noon, had no leisure to eat, and enjoyed the state for fifty years.'

sentences.zh: 作此以誡成王。

translations.literal: Composed this to admonish Cheng Wang.
translations.idiomatic: He composed this to admonish King Cheng.

sentences.zh: 成王在豐，天下已安，周之官政未次序，於是周公作周官，官別其宜，作立政，以便百姓。

translations.literal: Cheng Wang at Feng, world already peaceful, Zhou official administration not yet ordered, therefore Duke of Zhou composed Zhou Officials, officials distinguished their suitability, composed Establishing Government, to benefit common people.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng was at Feng. The world was already peaceful. Zhou's official administration was not yet ordered. Thereupon the Duke of Zhou composed the Zhou Officials, distinguishing officials according to their suitability, and composed the Establishing Government, to benefit the common people.

sentences.zh: 百姓說。

translations.literal: Common people pleased.
translations.idiomatic: The common people were pleased.

sentences.zh: 周公在豐，病，將沒，曰：「必葬我成周，以明吾不敢離成王。」

translations.literal: Duke of Zhou at Feng, ill, about to die, said: 'Must bury me Cheng Zhou, to show I not dared separate Cheng Wang.'
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou was at Feng and fell ill, about to die, saying: 'You must bury me at Chengzhou, to show that I dared not separate from King Cheng.'

sentences.zh: 周公既卒，成王亦讓，葬周公於畢，從文王，以明予小子不敢臣周公也。

translations.literal: Duke of Zhou already died, Cheng Wang also declined, buried Duke of Zhou at Bi, followed Wen Wang, to show I young one not dared minister Duke of Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou having died, King Cheng also declined, burying the Duke of Zhou at Bi, following King Wen, to show that I, the young one, dared not treat the Duke of Zhou as a minister.

sentences.zh: 周公卒後，秋未穫，暴風雷［雨］，禾盡偃，大木盡拔。

translations.literal: Duke of Zhou died after, autumn not yet harvested, violent wind thunder rain, grain all lay flat, great trees all uprooted.
translations.idiomatic: After the Duke of Zhou died, in autumn before the harvest, a violent wind, thunder, and rain occurred, the grain all lay flat, and the great trees were all uprooted.

sentences.zh: 周國大恐。

translations.literal: Zhou state greatly feared.
translations.idiomatic: The state of Zhou was greatly terrified.

sentences.zh: 成王與大夫朝服以開金縢書，王乃得周公所自以為功代武王之說。

translations.literal: Cheng Wang with grand masters court robes to opened gold wrapped slips, king then obtained Duke of Zhou self took as guilt substituted Wu Wang words.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng, together with the grandees in court robes, opened the gold-bound casket. The king then obtained the Duke of Zhou's words about how he had taken upon himself the guilt to substitute for King Wu.

sentences.zh: 二公及王乃問史百執事，史百執事曰：「信有，昔周公命我勿敢言。」

translations.literal: Two dukes and king then questioned scribe hundred officials, scribe hundred officials said: 'Truly have, past Duke of Zhou commanded me not dared speak.'
translations.idiomatic: The two dukes and the king then questioned the Scribe of the Hundred Officials. The Scribe of the Hundred Officials said: 'It is true. Formerly the Duke of Zhou commanded me not to dare speak of it.'

sentences.zh: 成王執書以泣，曰：「自今後其無繆卜乎！

translations.literal: Cheng Wang held slips to wept, said: 'From now after then no false divinations!
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng held the slips and wept, saying: 'From now on there will be no more false divinations!

sentences.zh: 昔周公勤勞王家，惟予幼人弗及知。

translations.literal: Past Duke of Zhou toiled diligently royal house, only I young person not reached know.
translations.idiomatic: Formerly the Duke of Zhou toiled diligently for the royal house. Only I, the young one, did not get to know it.

sentences.zh: 今天動威以彰周公之德，惟朕小子其迎，我國家禮亦宜之。」

translations.literal: Now heaven moved power to manifest Duke of Zhou virtue, only my young self then welcome, our state family rites also appropriate it.'
translations.idiomatic: Now heaven has moved its awe-inspiring power to manifest the Duke of Zhou's virtue. Only my young self should welcome it. Our state's rites also make it appropriate.'

sentences.zh: 王出郊，天乃雨，反風，禾盡起。

translations.literal: King exited suburbs, heaven then rained, reversed wind, grain all stood up.
translations.idiomatic: The king went out to the suburbs. Heaven then rained. The wind reversed direction. The grain all stood up.

sentences.zh: 二公命國人，凡大木所偃，盡起而筑之。

translations.literal: Two dukes commanded state people, all great trees that lay flat, all stood up and buttressed them.
translations.idiomatic: The two dukes commanded the people of the state: wherever great trees had been laid low, all were to stand them up and buttress them.

sentences.zh: 歲則大孰。

translations.literal: Year then great harvest.
translations.idiomatic: The year then had a great harvest.

sentences.zh: 於是成王乃命魯得郊祭文王。

translations.literal: Therefore Cheng Wang then commanded Lu obtained suburban sacrifice Wen Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon King Cheng then commanded that Lu should be permitted to perform the suburban sacrifice to King Wen.

sentences.zh: 魯有天子禮樂者，以褒周公之德也。

translations.literal: Lu had Son of Heaven rites music, to honor Duke of Zhou virtue.
translations.idiomatic: Lu having the rites and music of the Son of Heaven was to honor the Duke of Zhou's virtue.

sentences.zh: 周公卒，子伯禽固已前受封，是為魯公。

translations.literal: Duke of Zhou died, son Bo Qin already previously received enfeoffment, this was Lu Gong.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou died. His son Bo Qin had already previously received the enfeoffment. He became Duke of Lu.

sentences.zh: 魯公伯禽之初受封之魯，三年而後報政周公。

translations.literal: Lu Gong Bo Qin first received enfeoffment Lu, three years and after reported governance Duke of Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Bo Qin of Lu first received his enfeoffment at Lu, it was three years later that he reported on governance to the Duke of Zhou.

sentences.zh: 周公曰：「何遲也？」

translations.literal: Duke of Zhou said: 'Why late?'
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou said: 'Why are you so late?'

sentences.zh: 伯禽曰：「變其俗，革其禮，喪三年然後除之，故遲。」

translations.literal: Bo Qin said: 'Changed their customs, reformed their rites, mourning three years then after removed it, therefore late.'
translations.idiomatic: Bo Qin said: 'I changed their customs and reformed their rites. The mourning lasts three years before it is ended. Therefore it is late.'

sentences.zh: 太公亦封於齊，五月而報政周公。

translations.literal: Tai Gong also enfeoffed at Qi, five months and reported governance Duke of Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Duke was also enfeoffed at Qi. In five months he reported on governance to the Duke of Zhou.

sentences.zh: 周公曰：「何疾也？」

translations.literal: Duke of Zhou said: 'Why fast?'
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou said: 'Why are you so fast?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「吾簡其君臣禮，從其俗為也。」

translations.literal: Said: 'I simplified their ruler minister rites, followed their customs did it.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'I simplified the ruler and minister rites. I followed their customs to do it.'

sentences.zh: 及後聞伯禽報政遲，乃嘆曰：「嗚呼，魯後世其北面事齊矣！

translations.literal: And after heard Bo Qin reported governance late, then sighed said: 'Alas, Lu later generations then north faced served Qi!
translations.idiomatic: When later he heard that Bo Qin reported on governance late, he sighed and said: 'Alas, Lu's later generations will face north and serve the state of Qi!

sentences.zh: 夫政不簡不易，民不有近；

translations.literal: Indeed governance not simple not easy, people not have near;
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, governance that is not simple and easy, the people will not draw near;

sentences.zh: 平易近民，民必歸之。」

translations.literal: Level easy near people, people certainly returned to it.'
translations.idiomatic: Level and easy, close to the people, the people will surely return to it.'

sentences.zh: 伯禽即位之後，有管、蔡等反也，淮夷、徐戎亦并興反。

translations.literal: Bo Qin ascended throne after, had Guan, Cai and others rebelled, Huai barbarians, Xu Rong also together rose rebelled.
translations.idiomatic: After Bo Qin took the throne, there was the rebellion of Guan Shu, Cai Shu, and others. The Huai barbarians and Xu Rong also rose up together in rebellion.

sentences.zh: 於是伯禽率師伐之於肸，作肸誓，曰：「陳爾甲胄，無敢不善。

translations.literal: Therefore Bo Qin led troops attacked them at Fei, composed Fei Oath, said: 'Array your armor helmets, not dared not good.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Bo Qin led troops to attack them at Fei, composing the Fei Oath, saying: 'Array your armor and helmets. None dare be not good.

sentences.zh: 無敢傷牿。

translations.literal: Not dared wound cattle pens.
translations.idiomatic: None dare wound the cattle in their pens.

sentences.zh: 馬牛其風，臣妾逋逃，勿敢越逐，敬復之。

translations.literal: Horses oxen their frenzy, male female servants fled escaped, not dared cross pursued, respectfully returned them.
translations.idiomatic: Horses and oxen in their frenzy, and male and female servants fleeing, do not dare cross the boundaries in pursuit, but respectfully return them.

sentences.zh: 無敢寇攘，踰墻垣。

translations.literal: Not dared plunder seize, crossed over walls ramparts.
translations.idiomatic: None dare plunder and seize, cross over walls and ramparts.

sentences.zh: 魯人三郊三隧，峙爾芻茭、糗糧、楨榦，無敢不逮。

translations.literal: Lu people three suburbs three tunnels, prepared your fodder hay, dried provisions grain, bridge beams posts, not dared not reached.
translations.idiomatic: Lu people of the three suburbs and three tunnels, prepare your fodder and hay, dried provisions and grain, bridge beams and posts. None dare not reach.

sentences.zh: 我甲戌筑而征徐戎，無敢不及，有大刑。」

translations.literal: I Jia Xu day built fortifications and campaigned Xu Rong, not dared not arrived, had great punishment.'
translations.idiomatic: I on the day Jia Xu built fortifications and campaigned against the Xu Rong. None dare not arrive. There is great punishment.'

sentences.zh: 作此肸誓，遂平徐戎，定魯。

translations.literal: Composed this Fei Oath, then pacified Xu Rong, settled Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Having composed this Fei Oath, he then pacified the Xu Rong and settled Lu.

sentences.zh: 魯公伯禽卒，子考公酋立。

translations.literal: Lu Gong Bo Qin died, son Kao Gong Qiu established.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Bo Qin of Lu died. His son, Duke Kao Qiu, ascended.

sentences.zh: 考公四年卒，立弟熙，是謂煬公。

translations.literal: Kao Gong fourth year died, established younger brother Xi, this called Yang Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Kao died in his fourth year. His younger brother Xi ascended. This is Duke Yang.

sentences.zh: 煬公筑茅闕門。

translations.literal: Yang Gong built thatched tower gate.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Yang built the Thatched Tower Gate.

sentences.zh: 六年卒，子幽公宰立。

translations.literal: Sixth year died, son You Gong Zai established.
translations.idiomatic: He died in his sixth year. His son Duke You Zai ascended.

sentences.zh: 幽公十四年。

translations.literal: You Gong fourteenth year.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke You's fourteenth year.

sentences.zh: 幽公弟沸殺幽公而自立，是為魏公。

translations.literal: You Gong younger brother Fei killed You Gong and self established, this was Wei Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke You's younger brother Fei killed Duke You and established himself as the Duke Wei.

sentences.zh: 魏公五十年卒，子厲公擢立。

translations.literal: Wei Gong fiftieth year died, son Li Gong Zhuo established.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wei died in his fiftieth year. His son Duke Li Zhuo ascended.

sentences.zh: 厲公三十七年卒，魯人立其弟具，是為獻公。

translations.literal: Li Gong thirty-seventh year died, Lu people established his younger brother Ju, this was Xian Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Li died in his thirty-seventh year. The people of Lu established his younger brother Ju. This is Duke Xian.

sentences.zh: 獻公三十二年卒，子真公濞立。

translations.literal: Xian Gong thirty-second year died, son Zhen Gong Pi established.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian died in his thirty-second year. His son Duke Zhen Pi ascended.

sentences.zh: 真公十四年，周厲王無道，出奔彘，共和行政。

translations.literal: Zhen Gong fourteenth year, Zhou Li Wang no Way, exited fled Zhi, Gong He administered government.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Zhen's fourteenth year, King Li of Zhou was without the Way, fled to Zhi, and the Gonghe administered government.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，周宣王即位。

translations.literal: Twenty-ninth year, Zhou Xuan Wang ascended throne.
translations.idiomatic: In his twenty-ninth year, King Xuan of Zhou ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 三十年，真公卒，弟敖立，是為武公。

translations.literal: Thirtieth year, Zhen Gong died, younger brother Ao established, this was Wu Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In his thirtieth year, Duke Zhen died. His younger brother Ao ascended as the Duke Wu.

sentences.zh: 武公九年春，武公與長子括，少子戲，西朝周宣王。

translations.literal: Wu Gong ninth year spring, Wu Gong with eldest son Kuo, youngest son Xi, west courted Zhou Xuan Wang.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Wu's ninth year, in the spring, Duke Wu together with his eldest son Kuo and youngest son Xi, went west to court King Xuan of Zhou.

sentences.zh: 宣王愛戲，欲立戲為魯太子。

translations.literal: Xuan Wang loved Xi, wanted establish Xi as Lu crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: King Xuan loved Xi and wished to establish Xi as Lu's crown prince.

sentences.zh: 周之樊仲山父諫宣王曰：「廢長立少，不順；

translations.literal: Zhou Fan Zhong Shan Fu admonished Xuan Wang said: 'Discarded eldest established youngest, not orderly;
translations.idiomatic: Fan Zhong Shan Fu of Zhou admonished King Xuan, saying: 'Discarding the eldest and establishing the youngest is not orderly;

sentences.zh: 不順，必犯王命；

translations.literal: Not orderly, certainly violated king command;
translations.idiomatic: Not orderly, will certainly violate the king's command;

sentences.zh: 犯王命，必誅之：故出令不可不順也。

translations.literal: Violated king command, certainly punished it: therefore issued commands cannot not orderly.
translations.idiomatic: Violating the king's command, will certainly be punished: therefore issuing commands cannot but be orderly.

sentences.zh: 令之不行，政之不立；

translations.literal: Commands not carried out, government not established;
translations.idiomatic: Commands not carried out, government not established;

sentences.zh: 行而不順，民將棄上。

translations.literal: Carried out but not orderly, people will abandon superiors.
translations.idiomatic: Carried out but not orderly, the people will abandon their superiors.

sentences.zh: 夫下事上，少事長，所以為順。

translations.literal: Indeed lower served higher, younger served elder, this reason made order.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, the lower serving the higher, the younger serving the elder, this is what makes for order.

sentences.zh: 今天子建諸侯，立其少，是教民逆也。

translations.literal: Now Son of Heaven established feudal lords, established their youngest, this taught people contrary.
translations.idiomatic: Now the Son of Heaven establishes feudal lords, setting up their youngest, this teaches the people to be contrary.

sentences.zh: 若魯從之，諸侯效之，王命將有所壅；

translations.literal: If Lu followed it, feudal lords imitated it, king commands will have something obstructed;
translations.idiomatic: If Lu follows this, the feudal lords will imitate it, the king's commands will be obstructed;

sentences.zh: 若弗從而誅之，是自誅王命也。

translations.literal: If not followed and punished it, this was self punished king command.
translations.idiomatic: If not following and punishing it, this is to punish the king's command oneself.

sentences.zh: 誅之亦失，不誅亦失，王其圖之。」

translations.literal: Punished it also wrong, not punished also wrong, king then consider it.'
translations.idiomatic: Punishing it is also wrong, and not punishing it is also wrong. Your Majesty should consider the matter.'

sentences.zh: 宣王弗聽，卒立戲為魯太子。

translations.literal: Xuan Wang not listened, finally established Xi as Lu crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: King Xuan did not listen, and in the end established Xi as Lu's crown prince.

sentences.zh: 夏，武公歸而卒，戲立，是為懿公。

translations.literal: Summer, Wu Gong returned and died, Xi established, this was Yi Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the summer, Duke Wu returned and died. Xi ascended. This was the Duke Yi.

sentences.zh: 懿公九年，懿公兄括之子伯御與魯人攻弒懿公，而立伯御為君。

translations.literal: Yi Gong ninth year, Yi Gong elder brother Kuo son Bo Yu with Lu people attacked assassinated Yi Gong, and established Bo Yu as ruler.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Yi's ninth year, Duke Yi's elder brother Kuo's son Bo Yu, together with the people of Lu, attacked and assassinated Duke Yi, and established Bo Yu as ruler.

sentences.zh: 伯御即位十一年，周宣王伐魯，殺其君伯御，而問魯公子能道順諸侯者，以為魯後。

translations.literal: Bo Yu ascended throne eleven years, Zhou Xuan Wang attacked Lu, killed its ruler Bo Yu, and inquired Lu nobles able guide harmonize feudal lords, to make Lu successor.
translations.idiomatic: Bo Yu took the throne for eleven years. King Xuan of Zhou attacked Lu, killed its ruler Bo Yu, and inquired among the Lu nobles who could guide and harmonize the feudal lords, to make him Lu's successor.

sentences.zh: 樊穆仲曰：「魯懿公弟稱，肅恭明神，敬事耆老；

translations.literal: Fan Mu Zhong said: 'Lu Yi Gong younger brother Cheng, solemn respectful enlightened spirits, respectful served elders;
translations.idiomatic: Fan Mu Zhong said: 'Duke Yi of Lu's younger brother Cheng is solemn and respectful, enlightened about the spirits, respectful in serving the elders;

sentences.zh: 賦事行刑，必問於遺訓而咨於固實；

translations.literal: Assigned duties administered punishments, certainly asked at ancestral teachings and consulted at established precedents;
translations.idiomatic: In assigning duties and administering punishments, he certainly consults the ancestral teachings and seeks advice from established precedents;

sentences.zh: 不干所問，不犯所（知）［咨］。」

translations.literal: Not interfered what asked, not violated what consulted.'
translations.idiomatic: He does not interfere with the matters that have been asked, and does not violate the matters that have been consulted.'

sentences.zh: 宣王曰：「然，能訓治其民矣。」

translations.literal: Xuan Wang said: 'Yes, able instruct govern his people.'
translations.idiomatic: King Xuan said: 'Yes, he can instruct and govern his people.'

sentences.zh: 乃立稱於夷宮，是為孝公。

translations.literal: Then established Cheng at Yi Palace, this was Xiao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon he established Cheng in the Yi Palace. This was Duke Xiao.

sentences.zh: 自是後，諸侯多畔王命。

translations.literal: From this time after, feudal lords many rebelled king commands.
translations.idiomatic: From this time afterward, the feudal lords frequently rebelled against the king's commands.

sentences.zh: 孝公二十五年，諸侯畔周，犬戎殺幽王。

translations.literal: Xiao Gong twenty-fifth year, feudal lords rebelled Zhou, Quan Rong killed You Wang.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xiao's twenty-fifth year, the feudal lords rebelled against Zhou, and the Quan Rong killed King You.

sentences.zh: 秦始列為諸侯。

translations.literal: Qin began ranked as feudal lord.
translations.idiomatic: Qin began to be ranked as a feudal lord.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，孝公卒，子弗湟立，是為惠公。

translations.literal: Twenty-seventh year, Xiao Gong died, son Fu Huang established, this was Hui Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In his twenty-seventh year, Duke Xiao died. His son Fu Huang ascended the throne. This was Duke Hui.

sentences.zh: 惠公三十年，晉人弒其君昭侯。

translations.literal: Hui Gong thirtieth year, Jin people assassinated their ruler Zhao Hou.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Hui's thirtieth year, the Jin people assassinated their ruler Duke Zhao.

sentences.zh: 四十五年，晉人又弒其君孝侯。

translations.literal: Forty-fifth year, Jin people again assassinated their ruler Xiao Hou.
translations.idiomatic: In his forty-fifth year, the Jin people again assassinated their ruler Duke Xiao.

sentences.zh: 四十六年，惠公卒，長庶子息攝當國，行君事，是為隱公。

translations.literal: Forty-sixth year, Hui Gong died, eldest concubine son Xi acted governed state, conducted ruler affairs, this was Yin Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In his forty-sixth year, Duke Hui died. His eldest son by a concubine Xi acted as regent and conducted the ruler's affairs. This was Duke Yin.

sentences.zh: 初，惠公適夫人無子，公賤妾聲子生子息。

translations.literal: Initially, Hui Gong proper wife no sons, duke base concubine Sheng Zi gave birth son Xi.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, Duke Hui's proper wife had no sons. The duke's lowly concubine Sheng Zi gave birth to a son Xi.

sentences.zh: 息長，為娶於宋。

translations.literal: Xi grew, to married at Song.
translations.idiomatic: When Xi grew up, he took a wife from Song.

sentences.zh: 宋女至而好，惠公奪而自妻之。

translations.literal: Song woman arrived and beautiful, Hui Gong seized and self married her.
translations.idiomatic: The Song woman arrived and was beautiful. Duke Hui took her and made her his own wife.

sentences.zh: 生子允。

translations.literal: Gave birth son Yun.
translations.idiomatic: She gave birth to a son Yun.

sentences.zh: 登宋女為夫人，以允為太子。

translations.literal: Elevated Song woman as wife, made Yun as crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: He elevated the Song woman to be his wife, making Yun the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 及惠公卒，為允少故，魯人共令息攝政，不言即位。

translations.literal: When Hui Gong died, because Yun young reason, Lu people together commanded Xi act as regent, not spoke ascending throne.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Hui died, because Yun was young, the people of Lu together commanded Xi to act as regent, not speaking of ascending the throne.

sentences.zh: 隱公五年，觀漁於棠。

translations.literal: Yin Gong fifth year, observed fishing at Tang.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Yin's fifth year, he observed the fishing at Tang.

sentences.zh: 八年，與鄭易天子之太山之邑祊及許田，君子譏之。

translations.literal: Eighth year, with Zheng exchanged son of heaven's Tai Mountain's town Beng and Xu Fields, noble men criticized it.
translations.idiomatic: In his eighth year, he exchanged with Zheng the king's Tai Mountain town of Beng and Xu Fields. The noble men criticized it.

sentences.zh: 十一年冬，公子揮諂謂隱公曰：「百姓便君，君其遂立。

translations.literal: Eleventh year winter, prince Hui flattered said Yin Gong: 'Common people suitable lord, lord then establish.
translations.idiomatic: In his eleventh year, in winter, Prince Hui flattered Duke Yin, saying: 'The common people find you suitable, my lord. You should take the throne.

sentences.zh: 吾請為君殺子允，君以我為相。」

translations.literal: I beg for lord kill prince Yun, lord make me as chancellor.'
translations.idiomatic: I beg to kill Prince Yun for you, my lord. Make me your chancellor.'

sentences.zh: 隱公曰：「有先君命。

translations.literal: Yin Gong said: 'Has previous lord command.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Yin said: 'There is the previous lord's command.

sentences.zh: 吾為允少，故攝代。

translations.literal: I because Yun young, therefore acted as regent.
translations.idiomatic: I acted as regent because Yun was young.

sentences.zh: 今允長矣，吾方營菟裘之地而老焉，以授子允政。」

translations.literal: Now Yun grown, I am preparing Tu Qiu lands and grow old there, to hand over prince Yun governance.'
translations.idiomatic: Now Yun has grown up. I am preparing the Tu Qiu lands to grow old there, handing over governance to Prince Yun.'

sentences.zh: 揮懼子允聞而反誅之，乃反譖隱公於子允曰：「隱公欲遂立，去子，子其圖之。

translations.literal: Hui feared prince Yun heard and turn punish him, then instead slandered Yin Gong to prince Yun said: 'Yin Gong wishes establish, remove you, you then plan it.
translations.idiomatic: Hui feared that Yun would hear and turn to punish him, so instead he slandered Duke Yin to Yun, saying: 'Duke Yin wishes to take the throne permanently, removing you. You should plan for it.

sentences.zh: 請為子殺隱公。」

translations.literal: Beg for you kill Yin Gong.'
translations.idiomatic: I beg to kill Duke Yin for you.'

sentences.zh: 子允許諾。

translations.literal: Prince Yun agreed promised.
translations.idiomatic: Prince Yun agreed.

sentences.zh: 十一月，隱公祭鐘巫，齊于社圃，館于蒍氏。

translations.literal: Eleventh month, Yin Gong sacrificed Bell Spirit, purified at She Orchard, lodged at Kuai family.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, Duke Yin sacrificed to the Bell Spirit, purified himself at the She Orchard, and lodged at the Kuai family.

sentences.zh: 揮使人殺隱公于蒍氏，而立子允為君，是為桓公。

translations.literal: Hui sent person kill Yin Gong at Kuai family, and established prince Yun as ruler, this was Huan Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Hui sent someone to kill Duke Yin at the Kuai family, and established Prince Yun as ruler. This was Duke Huan.

sentences.zh: 桓公元年，鄭以璧易天子之許田。

translations.literal: Huan Gong first year, Zheng with jade disk exchanged son of heaven's Xu Fields.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Huan's first year, Zheng exchanged a jade disk for the king's Xu Fields.

sentences.zh: 二年，以宋之賂鼎入於太廟，君子譏之。

translations.literal: Second year, with Song's bribe tripod entered at Grand Temple, noble men criticized it.
translations.idiomatic: In his second year, he brought the bribe tripod from Song into the Grand Temple. The noble men criticized it.

sentences.zh: 三年，使揮迎婦于齊為夫人。

translations.literal: Third year, sent Hui welcome wife at Qi as consort.
translations.idiomatic: In his third year, he sent Hui to welcome a wife from Qi to be his consort.

sentences.zh: 六年，夫人生子，與桓公同日，故名曰同。

translations.literal: Sixth year, consort gave birth son, with Huan Gong same day, therefore named Tong.
translations.idiomatic: In his sixth year, the consort gave birth to a son on the same day as Duke Huan, therefore he was named Tong.

sentences.zh: 同長，為太子。

translations.literal: Tong grew, became crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: When Tong grew up, he became the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 十六年，會于曹，伐鄭，入厲公。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, met at Cao, attacked Zheng, entered Li Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In his sixteenth year, he met at Cao, attacked Zheng, and restored Duke Li.

sentences.zh: 十八年春，公將有行，遂與夫人如齊。

translations.literal: Eighteenth year spring, duke about to have travel, then with consort went Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In his eighteenth year, in spring, the duke was about to travel, and so went with his consort to Qi.

sentences.zh: 申繻諫止，公不聽，遂如齊。

translations.literal: Shen Xu advised stop, duke not listened, then went Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Shen Xu advised against it, but the duke did not listen, and so went to Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊襄公通桓公夫人。

translations.literal: Qi Xiang Gong had relations Huan Gong consort.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xiang of Qi had illicit relations with Duke Huan's consort.

sentences.zh: 公怒夫人，夫人以告齊侯。

translations.literal: Duke angered consort, consort with told Qi Hou.
translations.idiomatic: The duke became angry with his consort. The consort told Duke Xiang of Qi.

sentences.zh: 夏四月丙子，齊襄公饗公，公醉，使公子彭生抱魯桓公，因命彭生摺其脅，公死于車。

translations.literal: Summer fourth month bingzi day, Qi Xiang Gong feasted duke, duke drunk, sent prince Peng Sheng embrace Lu Huan Gong, then commanded Peng Sheng break his ribs, duke died at carriage.
translations.idiomatic: In summer, the fourth month, on the bingzi day, Duke Xiang of Qi feasted the duke. The duke became drunk, so he had Prince Peng Sheng embrace Duke Huan of Lu, and then commanded Peng Sheng to break his ribs. The duke died in the carriage.

sentences.zh: 魯人告于齊曰：「寡君畏君之威，不敢寧居，來修好禮。

translations.literal: Lu people informed at Qi said: 'Humble ruler fears lord's might, not dare peaceful dwell, came cultivate good rites.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Lu informed Qi, saying: 'Our humble ruler fears your lordship's might, not daring to rest peacefully, came to cultivate good relations.

sentences.zh: 禮成而不反，無所歸咎，請得彭生除丑於諸侯。」

translations.literal: Rites completed but not returned, nowhere place blame, beg obtain Peng Sheng remove shame at feudal lords.'
translations.idiomatic: The rites were completed but he did not return. There is nowhere to place the blame. We request to obtain Peng Sheng to remove the shame from the feudal lords.'

sentences.zh: 齊人殺彭生以說魯。

translations.literal: Qi people killed Peng Sheng to appease Lu.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Qi killed Peng Sheng to appease Lu.

sentences.zh: 立太子同，是為莊公。

translations.literal: Established crown prince Tong, this was Zhuang Gong.
translations.idiomatic: They established the crown prince Tong. This was Duke Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 莊公母夫人因留齊，不敢歸魯。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong mother consort consequently remained Qi, not dare return Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang's mother, the consort, consequently remained in Qi, not daring to return to Lu.

sentences.zh: 莊公五年冬，伐衛，內衛惠公。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong fifth year winter, attacked Wei, restored Wei Hui Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Zhuang's fifth year, in winter, he attacked Wei, restoring Duke Hui of Wei.

sentences.zh: 八年，齊公子糾來奔。

translations.literal: Eighth year, Qi prince Jiu came fleeing.
translations.idiomatic: In his eighth year, Prince Jiu of Qi came fleeing.

sentences.zh: 九年，魯欲內子糾於齊，後桓公，桓公發兵擊魯，魯急，殺子糾。

translations.literal: Ninth year, Lu wished restore prince Jiu at Qi, after Huan Gong, Huan Gong dispatched troops attacked Lu, Lu urgent, killed prince Jiu.
translations.idiomatic: In his ninth year, Lu wished to send Prince Jiu into Qi, after the time of Duke Huan. Duke Huan dispatched troops to attack Lu. Lu was distressed and killed Prince Jiu.

sentences.zh: 召忽死。

translations.literal: Zhao Hu died.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Hu died.

sentences.zh: 齊告魯生致管仲。

translations.literal: Qi informed Lu alive deliver Guan Zhong.
translations.idiomatic: Qi informed Lu to deliver Guan Zhong alive.

sentences.zh: 魯人施伯曰：「齊欲得管仲，非殺之也，將用之，用之則為魯患。

translations.literal: Lu person Shi Bo said: 'Qi wishes obtain Guan Zhong, not kill him, will employ him, employ him then becomes Lu calamity.
translations.idiomatic: The Lu person Shi Bo said: 'Qi wishes to obtain Guan Zhong, not to kill him. They will employ him. Employing him will become a calamity for Lu.

sentences.zh: 不如殺，以其尸與之。」

translations.literal: Not as good kill, with his corpse give them.'
translations.idiomatic: It would be better to kill him and give his corpse to them.'

sentences.zh: 莊公不聽，遂囚管仲與齊。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong not listened, then imprisoned Guan Zhong gave Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang did not listen, and so imprisoned Guan Zhong and gave him to Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊人相管仲。

translations.literal: Qi people made chancellor Guan Zhong.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Qi made Guan Zhong their chancellor.

sentences.zh: 十三年，魯莊公與曹沬會齊桓公於柯，曹沬劫齊桓公，求魯侵地，已盟而釋桓公。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, Lu Zhuang Gong with Cao Gui met Qi Huan Gong at Ke, Cao Gui abducted Qi Huan Gong, demanded Lu invaded territory, already covenanted then released Huan Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In his thirteenth year, Duke Zhuang of Lu and Cao Gui met Duke Huan of Qi at Ke. Cao Gui abducted Duke Huan of Qi, demanding Lu's invaded territory. After making the covenant, he released Duke Huan.

sentences.zh: 桓公欲背約，管仲諫，卒歸魯侵地。

translations.literal: Huan Gong wished break covenant, Guan Zhong advised, finally returned Lu invaded territory.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan wished to break the covenant. Guan Zhong advised against it. In the end they returned Lu's invaded territory.

sentences.zh: 十五年，齊桓公始霸。

translations.literal: Fifteenth year, Qi Huan Gong first became hegemon.
translations.idiomatic: In his fifteenth year, Duke Huan of Qi first became hegemon.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，莊公如齊觀社。

translations.literal: Twenty-third year, Zhuang Gong went Qi observed suburban sacrifice.
translations.idiomatic: In his twenty-third year, Duke Zhuang went to Qi to observe the suburban sacrifice.

sentences.zh: 三十二年，初，莊公筑臺臨黨氏，見孟女，說而愛之，許立為夫人，割臂以盟。

translations.literal: Thirty-second year, initially, Zhuang Gong built tower overlooking Dang family, saw Meng woman, pleased and loved her, promised establish as consort, cut arm to covenant.
translations.idiomatic: In his thirty-second year, initially, Duke Zhuang built a tower overlooking the Dang family, saw the Meng woman, was pleased and loved her, promised to establish her as his consort, cut his arm to make covenant.

sentences.zh: 孟女生子斑。

translations.literal: Meng woman gave birth son Ban.
translations.idiomatic: The Meng woman gave birth to a son Ban.

sentences.zh: 斑長，說梁氏女，往觀。

translations.literal: Ban grew, pleased Liang family woman, went observed.
translations.idiomatic: Ban grew up, was pleased with the Liang family woman, went to observe her.

sentences.zh: 圉人犖自墻外與梁氏女戲。

translations.literal: Stableman Luo from wall outside with Liang family woman played.
translations.idiomatic: The stableman Luo from outside the wall flirted with the Liang family woman.

sentences.zh: 斑怒，鞭犖。

translations.literal: Ban angered, whipped Luo.
translations.idiomatic: Ban was angry, whipped Luo.

sentences.zh: 莊公聞之，曰：「犖有力焉，遂殺之，是未可鞭而置也。」

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong heard it, said: 'Luo has strength, then kill him, this not can whip and set aside.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang heard of it and said: 'Luo has the strength. You should then kill him. This is not a person who can be whipped and set aside.'

sentences.zh: 斑未得殺。

translations.literal: Ban not yet obtained kill.
translations.idiomatic: Ban had not yet been able to kill him.

sentences.zh: 會莊公有疾。

translations.literal: Happened Zhuang Gong had illness.
translations.idiomatic: It happened that Duke Zhuang fell ill.

sentences.zh: 莊公有三弟，長曰慶父，次曰叔牙，次曰季友。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong had three younger brothers, eldest called Qing Fu, second called Shu Ya, second called Ji You.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang had three younger brothers: the eldest called Qing Fu, the middle called Shu Ya, the youngest called Ji You.

sentences.zh: 莊公取齊女為夫人曰哀姜。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong took Qi woman as consort called Ai Jiang.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang took a Qi woman as his consort, named Ai Jiang.

sentences.zh: 哀姜無子。

translations.literal: Ai Jiang no sons.
translations.idiomatic: Ai Jiang had no sons.

sentences.zh: 哀姜娣曰叔姜，生子開。

translations.literal: Ai Jiang younger sister called Shu Jiang, gave birth son Kai.
translations.idiomatic: Ai Jiang's younger sister called Shu Jiang gave birth to a son Kai.

sentences.zh: 莊公無適嗣，愛孟女，欲立其子斑。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong no proper heir, loved Meng woman, wished establish her son Ban.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang had no proper heir, loved the Meng woman, wished to establish her son Ban.

sentences.zh: 莊公病，而問嗣於弟叔牙。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong ill, and asked succession at younger brother Shu Ya.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang fell ill, and consulted his younger brother Shu Ya about the succession.

sentences.zh: 叔牙曰：「一繼一及，魯之常也。

translations.literal: Shu Ya said: 'One succeed one extend, Lu's constant practice.
translations.idiomatic: Shu Ya said: 'One succeeds one, one extends to another, this is Lu's constant practice.

sentences.zh: 慶父在，可為嗣，君何憂？」

translations.literal: Qing Fu present, can be successor, lord why worry?'
translations.idiomatic: Qing Fu is present, can be the successor. Why does my lord worry?'

sentences.zh: 莊公患叔牙欲立慶父，退而問季友。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong concerned Shu Ya wished establish Qing Fu, withdrew and asked Ji You.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang was concerned that Shu Ya wished to establish Qing Fu as the successor, so he withdrew and consulted Ji You.

sentences.zh: 季友曰：「請以死立斑也。」

translations.literal: Ji You said: 'Beg with death establish Ban.'
translations.idiomatic: Ji You said: 'I beg to die establishing Ban.'

sentences.zh: 莊公曰：「曩者叔牙欲立慶父，柰何？」

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong said: 'Formerly Shu Ya wished establish Qing Fu, what to do?'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang said: 'Formerly Shu Ya wished to establish Qing Fu as the successor. What should we do?'

sentences.zh: 季友以莊公命命牙待於鍼巫氏，使鍼季劫飲叔牙以鴆，曰：「飲此則有後奉祀；

translations.literal: Ji You with Zhuang Gong command commanded Ya wait at Zhen Wu family, sent Zhen Ji force drink Shu Ya with poison, said: 'Drink this then have descendants continue sacrifices;
translations.idiomatic: Ji You, by Duke Zhuang's command, ordered Ya to wait at the Zhen Wu family, had Zhen Ji force Shu Ya to drink poison, saying: 'Drink this and you will have descendants to continue the sacrifices;

sentences.zh: 不然，死且無後。」

translations.literal: Not so, die and no descendants.'
translations.idiomatic: If not, you will die and have no descendants.'

sentences.zh: 牙遂飲鴆而死，魯立其子為叔孫氏。

translations.literal: Ya then drank poison and died, Lu established his son as Shu Sun clan.
translations.idiomatic: Ya then drank the poison and died. Lu established his son as the Shu Sun clan.

sentences.zh: 八月癸亥，莊公卒，季友竟立子斑為君，如莊公命。

translations.literal: Eighth month guihai day, Zhuang Gong died, Ji You finally established prince Ban as ruler, as Zhuang Gong commanded.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, on the guihai day, Duke Zhuang died. Ji You finally established Prince Ban as ruler, as Duke Zhuang commanded.

sentences.zh: 侍喪，舍于黨氏。

translations.literal: Attended mourning, lodged at Dang family.
translations.idiomatic: Attending the mourning, he lodged at the Dang family.

sentences.zh: 先時慶父與哀姜私通，欲立哀姜娣子開。

translations.literal: Previously Qing Fu with Ai Jiang had relations, wished establish Ai Jiang younger sister son Kai.
translations.idiomatic: Previously Qing Fu had illicit relations with Ai Jiang, wishing to establish the son of Ai Jiang's younger sister, Kai.

sentences.zh: 及莊公卒而季友立斑，十月己未，慶父使圉人犖殺魯公子斑於黨氏。

translations.literal: When Zhuang Gong died and Ji You established Ban, tenth month jisi day, Qing Fu sent stableman Luo kill Lu prince Ban at Dang family.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Zhuang died and Ji You established Ban, in the tenth month, on the jisi day, Qing Fu had the groom Luo kill Lu's Prince Ban at the Dang family.

sentences.zh: 季友奔陳。

translations.literal: Ji You fled Chen.
translations.idiomatic: Ji You fled to Chen.

sentences.zh: 慶父竟立莊公子開，是為湣公。

translations.literal: Qing Fu ultimately established Zhuang Gong son Kai, this was Min Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Qing Fu ultimately established Duke Zhuang's son Kai. This was Duke Min.

sentences.zh: 湣公二年，慶父與哀姜通益甚。

translations.literal: Min Gong second year, Qing Fu with Ai Jiang relations increasingly intimate.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Min's second year, Qing Fu's relations with Ai Jiang became increasingly intimate.

sentences.zh: 哀姜與慶父謀殺湣公而立慶父。

translations.literal: Ai Jiang with Qing Fu plotted kill Min Gong and establish Qing Fu.
translations.idiomatic: Ai Jiang and Qing Fu plotted to kill Duke Min and establish Qing Fu.

sentences.zh: 慶父使卜齮襲殺湣公於武闈。

translations.literal: Qing Fu sent Bo Xi ambush kill Min Gong at Wu Gate.
translations.idiomatic: Qing Fu had Bo Xi ambush and kill Duke Min at the Wu Gate.

sentences.zh: 季友聞之，自陳與湣公弟申如邾，請魯求內之。

translations.literal: Ji You heard it, from Chen with Min Gong younger brother Shen went Zhu, requested Lu seek restore him.
translations.idiomatic: Ji You heard of it. From Chen, together with the younger brother of Duke Min, Shen, he went to Zhu, requesting that Lu invite him back.

sentences.zh: 魯人欲誅慶父。

translations.literal: Lu people wished execute Qing Fu.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Lu wished to execute Qing Fu.

sentences.zh: 慶父恐，奔莒。

translations.literal: Qing Fu feared, fled Ju.
translations.idiomatic: Qing Fu feared and fled to Ju.

sentences.zh: 於是季友奉子申入，立之，是為釐公。

translations.literal: Thereupon Ji You escorted prince Shen entered, established him, this was Xi Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Ji You escorted Zi Shen in and established him as the ruler. This was Duke Xi.

sentences.zh: 釐公亦莊公少子。

translations.literal: Xi Gong also Zhuang Gong youngest son.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xi was also Duke Zhuang's youngest son.

sentences.zh: 哀姜恐，奔邾。

translations.literal: Ai Jiang feared, fled Zhu.
translations.idiomatic: Ai Jiang feared and fled to Zhu.

sentences.zh: 季友以賂如莒求慶父，慶父歸，使人殺慶父，慶父請奔，弗聽，乃使大夫奚斯行哭而往。

translations.literal: Ji You with bribes went Ju sought Qing Fu, Qing Fu returned, sent person kill Qing Fu, Qing Fu requested flee, not listened, then sent grandee Xi Si went weeping and went.
translations.idiomatic: Ji You went to Ju with bribes to seek Qing Fu. Qing Fu returned. He sent someone to kill Qing Fu. Qing Fu requested to flee but was not permitted. He then had the grandee Xi Si go weeping to him.

sentences.zh: 慶父聞奚斯音，乃自殺。

translations.literal: Qing Fu heard Xi Si voice, then self killed.
translations.idiomatic: Qing Fu heard Xi Si's voice and committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 齊桓公聞哀姜與慶父亂以危魯，及召之邾而殺之，以其尸歸，戮之魯。

translations.literal: Qi Huan Gong heard Ai Jiang with Qing Fu chaos to endanger Lu, then summoned her Zhu and killed her, with her corpse returned, displayed her Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan of Qi heard that Ai Jiang and Qing Fu had caused chaos and endangered Lu. He summoned her to Zhu and killed her, then returned with her corpse and displayed it in the state of Lu.

sentences.zh: 魯釐公請而葬之。

translations.literal: Lu Xi Gong requested and buried her.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xi of Lu requested and buried her.

sentences.zh: 季友母陳女，故亡在陳，陳故佐送季友及子申。

translations.literal: Ji You mother Chen woman, therefore fled at Chen, Chen therefore assisted escorted Ji You and prince Shen.
translations.idiomatic: Ji You's mother was a woman of Chen. Therefore he had fled to Chen. Chen had assisted in escorting Ji You and Zi Shen.

sentences.zh: 季友之將生也，父魯桓公使人卜之，曰：「男也，其名曰『友』，閒于兩社，為公室輔。

translations.literal: Ji You about to be born, father Lu Huan Gong sent person divined it, said: 'Boy, his name called 'You', mediate at two altars, become ducal house auxiliary.
translations.idiomatic: When Ji You was about to be born, his father Duke Huan of Lu had someone divine about it, saying: "It is a boy. His name shall be 'You'. He will mediate between the two altars, becoming an auxiliary to the ducal house.

sentences.zh: 季友亡，則魯不昌。」

translations.literal: Ji You perishes, then Lu not prosper.'
translations.idiomatic: If Ji You perishes, then Lu will not prosper."

sentences.zh: 及生，有文在掌曰「友」，遂以名之，號為成季。

translations.literal: When born, had writing at palm said 'You', then with named him, called Cheng Ji.
translations.idiomatic: When he was born, there was writing on the palm of his hand saying "You". He was thus named accordingly and called Cheng Ji.

sentences.zh: 其後為季氏，慶父後為孟氏也。

translations.literal: His descendants became Ji clan, Qing Fu descendants became Meng clan.
translations.idiomatic: His descendants became the Ji clan. Qing Fu's descendants became the Meng clan.

sentences.zh: 釐公元年，以汶陽鄪封季友。

translations.literal: Xi Gong first year, with Wen Yang Bi enfeoffed Ji You.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xi's first year, he enfeoffed Ji You with Bi in Wen Yang.

sentences.zh: 季友為相。

translations.literal: Ji You became chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: Ji You became prime minister.

sentences.zh: 九年，晉裏克殺其君奚齊、卓子。

translations.literal: Ninth year, Jin Li Ke assassinated his ruler Xi Qi, Zhuo Zi.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Jin's Li Ke assassinated his rulers Xi Qi and Zhuo Zi.

sentences.zh: 齊桓公率釐公討晉亂，至高梁而還，立晉惠公。

translations.literal: Qi Huan Gong led Xi Gong punished Jin disorder, reached Gao Liang and returned, established Jin Hui Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan of Qi led Duke Xi to punish the Jin disorder. They reached Gao Liang and returned, establishing Duke Hui of Jin.

sentences.zh: 十七年，齊桓公卒。

translations.literal: Seventeenth year, Qi Huan Gong died.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, Duke Huan of Qi died.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，晉文公即位。

translations.literal: Twenty-fourth year, Jin Wen Gong ascended throne.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, Duke Wen of Jin took the throne.

sentences.zh: 三十三年，釐公卒，子興立，是為文公。

translations.literal: Thirty-third year, Xi Gong died, son Xing established, this was Wen Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-third year, Duke Xi died. His son Xing succeeded him. This was Duke Wen.

sentences.zh: 文公元年，楚太子商臣弒其父成王，代立。

translations.literal: Wen Gong first year, Chu crown prince Shang Chen assassinated his father Cheng Wang, replaced established.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Wen's first year, Chu's heir apparent Shang Chen assassinated his father King Cheng and took the throne.

sentences.zh: 三年，文公朝晉襄父。

translations.literal: Third year, Wen Gong paid court Jin Xiang Fu.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Duke Wen paid court to Jin's Xiang Fu.

sentences.zh: 十一年十月甲午，魯敗翟于咸，獲長翟喬如，富父終甥舂其喉，以戈殺之，埋其首於子駒之門，以命宣伯。

translations.literal: Eleventh year tenth month jiawu day, Lu defeated Di at Xian, captured Chang Di Qiao Ru, Fu Fu Zhong Sheng pounded his throat, with spear killed him, buried his head at Zi Ju gate, with appointed Xuan Bo.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, in the tenth month, on the jiawu day, Lu defeated the Di at Xian, capturing the Chang Di Qiao Ru. Fu Fu Zhong Sheng pounded his throat with a spear and killed him, burying his head at Zi Ju's gate, thereby appointing Xuan Bo.

sentences.zh: 初，宋武公之世，鄋瞞伐宋，司徒皇父帥師御之，以敗翟于長丘，獲長翟緣斯。

translations.literal: Initially, Song Wu Gong time, Mang Man attacked Song, Minister of Works Huang Fu led troops resisted them, with defeated Di at Chang Qiu, captured Chang Di Yuan Si.
translations.idiomatic: Previously, in Duke Wu of Song's time, Mang Man attacked Song. The Minister of Works Huang Fu led troops to resist them, thereby defeating the Di at Chang Qiu and capturing the Chang Di Yuan Si.

sentences.zh: 晉之滅路，獲喬如弟棼如。

translations.literal: Jin extinguished Lu, captured Qiao Ru younger brother Fen Ru.
translations.idiomatic: When Jin extinguished Lu, they captured Qiao Ru's younger brother Fen Ru.

sentences.zh: 齊惠公二年，鄋瞞伐齊，齊王子城父獲其弟榮如，埋其首於北門。

translations.literal: Qi Hui Gong second year, Mang Man attacked Qi, Qi prince Zi Cheng Fu captured his younger brother Rong Ru, buried his head at north gate.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Hui of Qi's second year, Mang Man attacked Qi. Qi's noble Zi Cheng Fu captured his younger brother Rong Ru, burying his head at the north gate.

sentences.zh: 衛人獲其季弟簡如。

translations.literal: Wei people captured his youngest brother Jian Ru.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Wei captured his youngest brother Jian Ru.

sentences.zh: 鄋瞞由是遂亡。

translations.literal: Mang Man from this then consequently perished.
translations.idiomatic: Mang Man from this point on consequently perished.

sentences.zh: 十五年，季文子使於晉。

translations.literal: Fifteenth year, Ji Wen Zi sent at Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, Ji Wen Zi was sent on a mission to Jin.

sentences.zh: 十八年二月，文公卒。

translations.literal: Eighteenth year second month, Wen Gong died.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, in the second month, Duke Wen died.

sentences.zh: 文公有二妃：長妃齊女為哀姜，生子惡及視；

translations.literal: Wen Gong had two consorts: senior consort Qi woman was Ai Jiang, gave birth sons E and Shi;
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wen had two consorts: the senior consort was a Qi woman called Ai Jiang, who bore sons E and Shi;

sentences.zh: 次妃敬嬴，嬖愛，生子俀。

translations.literal: Junior consort Jing Ying, favored beloved, gave birth son You.
translations.idiomatic: The junior consort Jing Ying was favored and beloved, bearing son You.

sentences.zh: 俀私事襄仲，襄仲欲立之，叔仲曰不可。

translations.literal: You privately served Xiang Zhong, Xiang Zhong wished establish him, Shu Zhong said not permissible.
translations.idiomatic: You privately served Xiang Zhong. Xiang Zhong wished to establish him as the successor. Shu Zhong said that it was not permissible.

sentences.zh: 襄仲請齊惠公，惠公新立，欲親魯，許之。

translations.literal: Xiang Zhong petitioned Qi Hui Gong, Hui Gong newly established, wished close Lu, agreed it.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Zhong petitioned Duke Hui of Qi. Duke Hui had newly taken the throne and wished to be close to Lu, so he agreed.

sentences.zh: 冬十月，襄仲殺子惡及視而立俀，是為宣公。

translations.literal: Winter tenth month, Xiang Zhong killed prince E and Shi and established You, this was Xuan Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In winter, in the tenth month, Xiang Zhong killed Zi E and Shi and established You. This was Duke Xuan.

sentences.zh: 哀姜歸齊，哭而過市，曰：「天乎！

translations.literal: Ai Jiang returned Qi, wept and passed market, said: 'Heaven!
translations.idiomatic: Ai Jiang returned to Qi, weeping as she passed through the market, saying: "Heaven above!

sentences.zh: 襄仲為不道，殺適立庶！」

translations.literal: Xiang Zhong acts without Way, killed legitimate established concubine son!'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Zhong acts without righteousness, killing the legitimate heir and establishing the concubine's son!"

sentences.zh: 市人皆哭，魯人謂之「哀姜」。

translations.literal: Market people all wept, Lu people called her 'Ai Jiang'.
translations.idiomatic: All the people of the market wept. The people of Lu called her "Ai Jiang".

sentences.zh: 魯由此公室卑，三桓彊。

translations.literal: Lu from this ducal house declined, Three Huan strong.
translations.idiomatic: From this Lu's ducal house declined, the Three Huan grew strong.

sentences.zh: 宣公俀十二年，楚莊王彊，圍鄭。

translations.literal: Xuan Gong You twelfth year, Chu Zhuang Wang strong, besieged Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xuan You's twelfth year, Chu's King Zhuang became strong and besieged Zheng.

sentences.zh: 鄭伯降，復國之。

translations.literal: Zheng Bo submitted, restored state to him.
translations.idiomatic: The Lord of Zheng submitted, so he restored the state to him.

sentences.zh: 十八年，宣公卒，子成公黑肱立，是為成公。

translations.literal: Eighteenth year, Xuan Gong died, son Cheng Gong Hei Gong established, this was Cheng Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, Duke Xuan died. His son Duke Cheng Hei Gong succeeded him. This was Duke Cheng.

sentences.zh: 季文子曰：「使我殺適立庶失大援者，襄仲。」

translations.literal: Ji Wen Zi said: 'Made me kill legitimate establish concubine lost great support person, Xiang Zhong.'
translations.idiomatic: Ji Wen Zi said: "The one who made me kill the legitimate heir and establish the concubine's son, thus losing our great ally, was Xiang Zhong."

sentences.zh: 襄仲立宣公，公孫歸父有寵。

translations.literal: Xiang Zhong established Xuan Gong, Gong Sun Gui Fu had favor.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Zhong established Duke Xuan. Gong Sun Gui Fu was favored.

sentences.zh: 宣公欲去三桓，與晉謀伐三桓。

translations.literal: Xuan Gong wished remove Three Huan, with Jin plotted attack Three Huan.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xuan wished to remove the Three Huan and plotted with Jin to attack the Three Huan.

sentences.zh: 會宣公卒，季文子怨之，歸父奔齊。

translations.literal: When Xuan Gong died, Ji Wen Zi resented it, Gui Fu fled Qi.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Xuan died, Ji Wen Zi resented the matter. Gui Fu fled to Qi.

sentences.zh: 成公二年春，齊伐取我隆。

translations.literal: Cheng Gong second year spring, Qi attacked took our Long.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Cheng's second year, in spring, Qi attacked and took our Long.

sentences.zh: 夏，公與晉郤克敗齊頃公於砹齊復歸我侵地。

translations.literal: Summer, duke with Jin Xi Ke defeated Qi Qing Gong at Ai, Qi again returned our invaded territories.
translations.idiomatic: In summer, the duke and Jin's Xi Ke defeated Qi's Duke Qing at Ai. Qi returned our invaded territories.

sentences.zh: 四年，成公如晉，晉景公不敬魯。

translations.literal: Fourth year, Cheng Gong went Jin, Jin Jing Gong not respectful Lu.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Duke Cheng went to Jin. Jin's Duke Jing was disrespectful to Lu.

sentences.zh: 魯欲背晉合於楚，或諫，乃不。

translations.literal: Lu wished abandon Jin ally at Chu, some advised, then not.
translations.idiomatic: Lu wished to abandon Jin and ally with Chu. Some advised against it, so they did not.

sentences.zh: 十年，成公如晉。

translations.literal: Tenth year, Cheng Gong went Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Duke Cheng went to Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉景公卒，因留成公送葬，魯諱之。

translations.literal: Jin Jing Gong died, therefore detained Cheng Gong attend funeral, Lu considered it insult.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing of Jin died. They detained Duke Cheng to attend the funeral. Lu considered it an insult.

sentences.zh: 十五年，始與吳王壽夢會鐘離。

translations.literal: Fifteenth year, first with Wu Wang Shou Meng met Zhong Li.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, they first met with Wu King Shou Meng at Zhong Li.

sentences.zh: 十六年，宣伯告晉，欲誅季文子。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, Xuan Bo informed Jin, wished execute Ji Wen Zi.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Xuan Bo informed Jin, wishing to execute Ji Wen Zi.

sentences.zh: 文子有義，晉人弗許。

translations.literal: Wen Zi had righteousness, Jin people not permitted it.
translations.idiomatic: Wen Zi had righteousness. The Jin people did not permit it.

sentences.zh: 十八年，成公卒，子午立，是為襄公。

translations.literal: Eighteenth year, Cheng Gong died, son Wu established, this was Xiang Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, Duke Cheng died. His son Wu succeeded him. This was Duke Xiang.

sentences.zh: 是時襄公三歲也。

translations.literal: This time Xiang Gong three years old.
translations.idiomatic: At this time Duke Xiang was three years old.

sentences.zh: 襄公元年，晉立悼公。

translations.literal: Xiang Gong first year, Jin established Dao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xiang's first year, Jin established Duke Dao.

sentences.zh: 往年冬，晉欒書弒其君厲公。

translations.literal: Previous year winter, Jin Luan Shu assassinated his ruler Li Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the previous year's winter, Jin's Luan Shu assassinated his ruler Duke Li.

sentences.zh: 四年，襄公朝晉。

translations.literal: Fourth year, Xiang Gong paid court Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Duke Xiang paid court to Jin.

sentences.zh: 五年，季文子卒。

translations.literal: Fifth year, Ji Wen Zi died.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, Ji Wen Zi died.

sentences.zh: 家無衣帛之妾，廄無食粟之馬，府無金玉，以相三君。

translations.literal: Household no clothed silk concubines, stables no eating grain horses, treasury no gold jade, with served three rulers.
translations.idiomatic: His household had no concubines clothed in the silk. His stables had no horses eating the grain. His treasury had no gold or jade. With this he served the three rulers.

sentences.zh: 君子曰：「季文子廉忠矣。」

translations.literal: Noble man said: 'Ji Wen Zi incorruptible loyal.'
translations.idiomatic: The noble man said: "Ji Wen Zi was incorruptible and loyal."

sentences.zh: 九年，與晉伐鄭。

translations.literal: Ninth year, with Jin attacked Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, together with Jin they attacked Zheng.

sentences.zh: 晉悼公冠襄公於衛，季武子從，相行禮。

translations.literal: Jin Dao Gong capped Xiang Gong at Wei, Ji Wu Zi followed, assisted performed rites.
translations.idiomatic: Jin's Duke Dao performed the capping ceremony for Duke Xiang in Wei. Ji Wu Zi accompanied him and assisted with the rituals.

sentences.zh: 十一年，三桓氏分為三軍。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, Three Huan clans divided as three armies.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, the Three Huan clans divided into three armies.

sentences.zh: 十二年，朝晉。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, paid court Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, he paid court to Jin.

sentences.zh: 十六年，晉平公即位。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, Jin Ping Gong ascended throne.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Duke Ping of Jin took the throne.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，朝晉平公。

translations.literal: Twenty-first year, paid court Jin Ping Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, he paid court to Duke Ping of Jin.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，孔丘生。

translations.literal: Twenty-second year, Kong Qiu born.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, Kong Qiu was born.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，齊崔杼弒其君莊公，立其弟景公。

translations.literal: Twenty-fifth year, Qi Cui Zhu assassinated his ruler Zhuang Gong, established his younger brother Jing Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, Qi's Cui Zhu assassinated his ruler Duke Zhuang and installed his younger brother Duke Jing.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，吳延陵季子使魯，問周樂，盡知其意，魯人敬焉。

translations.literal: Twenty-ninth year, Wu Yanling Ji Zi sent Lu, asked Zhou music, fully knew its meaning, Lu people respected him.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Wu's Yanling Ji Zi was sent to Lu. He inquired about Zhou music and fully understood its meaning. The people of Lu respected him.

sentences.zh: 三十一年六月，襄公卒。

translations.literal: Thirty-first year sixth month, Xiang Gong died.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-first year, in the sixth month, Duke Xiang died.

sentences.zh: 其九月，太子卒。

translations.literal: That ninth month, crown prince died.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month, the heir apparent died.

sentences.zh: 魯人立齊歸之子裯為君，是為昭公。

translations.literal: Lu people established Qi Gui son Chou as ruler, this was Zhao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Lu installed the son of Qi Gui, Chou, as ruler. This was Duke Zhao.

sentences.zh: 昭公年十九，猶有童心。

translations.literal: Zhao Gong age nineteen, still had child heart.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhao was nineteen years old and still had a childish heart.

sentences.zh: 穆叔不欲立，曰：「太子死，有母弟可立，不即立長。

translations.literal: Mu Shu not wished establish, said: 'Crown prince died, have mother younger brothers can establish, not immediately establish eldest.
translations.idiomatic: Mu Shu did not wish to establish him, saying: "The heir apparent died. There are younger brothers by the same mother who can be established. One should not immediately establish the eldest.

sentences.zh: 年鈞擇賢，義鈞則卜之。

translations.literal: Age equal choose worthy, righteousness equal then divine it.
translations.idiomatic: If ages are equal, choose the worthy. If righteousness is equal, then divine about it.

sentences.zh: 今裯非適嗣，且又居喪意不在戚而有喜色，若果立，必為季氏憂。」
