translations.literal: Now Chou not proper heir, and moreover during mourning thoughts not at grief but have happy expression, if indeed established, certainly become Ji clan worry.'
translations.idiomatic: Now Chou is not the proper heir, and moreover during mourning his thoughts are not on grief but show happy colors. If he is indeed established, he will certainly become a worry for the Ji clan."

sentences.zh: 季武子弗聽，卒立之。

translations.literal: Ji Wu Zi not listened, finally established him.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Wu Zi did not listen and ultimately established him.

sentences.zh: 比及葬，三易衰。

translations.literal: By time burial, three changed mourning garments.
translations.idiomatic: By the time of the burial, he had changed mourning garments three times.

sentences.zh: 君子曰：「是不終也。」

translations.literal: Noble man said: 'This not end.'
translations.idiomatic: The gentleman said: "This is not seeing it through to the end."

sentences.zh: 昭公三年，朝晉至河，晉平公謝還之，魯恥焉。

translations.literal: Zhao Gong third year, paid court Jin reached river, Jin Ping Gong apologized returned him, Lu ashamed.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Zhao's third year, he went to court Jin but reached the river. Duke Ping of Jin apologized and sent him back. Lu was ashamed.

sentences.zh: 四年，楚靈王會諸侯於申，昭公稱病不往。

translations.literal: Fourth year, Chu Ling Wang assembled feudal lords at Shen, Zhao Gong claimed illness not went.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Chu's King Ling assembled the feudal lords at Shen. Duke Zhao claimed illness and did not go.

sentences.zh: 七年，季武子卒。

translations.literal: Seventh year, Ji Wu Zi died.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Ji Wu Zi died.

sentences.zh: 八年，楚靈王就章華臺，召昭公。

translations.literal: Eighth year, Chu Ling Wang completed Zhanghua Terrace, summoned Zhao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Chu's King Ling completed the Zhanghua Terrace and summoned Duke Zhao.

sentences.zh: 昭公往賀，賜昭公寶器；

translations.literal: Zhao Gong went congratulated, bestowed Zhao Gong precious vessels;
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhao went to congratulate him. He bestowed precious vessels upon Duke Zhao;

sentences.zh: 已而悔，復詐取之。

translations.literal: Already then regretted, again deceitfully took them.
translations.idiomatic: Soon after he regretted it and deceitfully took them back.

sentences.zh: 十二年，朝晉至河，晉平公謝還之。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, paid court Jin reached river, Jin Ping Gong apologized returned him.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, he went to court Jin but reached the river. Duke Ping of Jin apologized and sent him back.

sentences.zh: 十三年，楚公子棄疾弒其君靈王，代立。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, Chu prince Qi Ji assassinated his ruler Ling Wang, replaced established.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Chu's Prince Qi Ji assassinated his ruler King Ling and took his place.

sentences.zh: 十五年，朝晉，晉留之葬晉昭公，魯恥之。

translations.literal: Fifteenth year, paid court Jin, Jin detained him attend Jin Zhao Gong funeral, Lu ashamed it.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, he went to court in Jin. Jin detained him to attend Duke Zhao of Jin's funeral. Lu was ashamed.

sentences.zh: 二十年，齊景公與晏子狩竟，因入魯問禮。

translations.literal: Twentieth year, Qi Jing Gong with Yan Zi hunted border, then entered Lu asked rites.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, Duke Jing of Qi and Yan Zi hunted along the border, then entered Lu to inquire about rituals.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，朝晉至河，晉謝還之。

translations.literal: Twenty-first year, paid court Jin reached river, Jin apologized returned him.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, he went to court Jin but reached the river. Jin apologized and sent him back.

sentences.zh: 二十五年春，鸜鵒來巢。

translations.literal: Twenty-fifth year spring, phoenix came nested.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, in spring, the phoenix came to nest.

sentences.zh: 師己曰：「文成之世童謠曰『鸜鵒來巢，公在乾侯。

translations.literal: Shi Ji said: 'Wen Cheng time children's rhyme said 'Phoenix came nested, duke at Gan Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Shi Ji said: "In Duke Wen's time there was a children's rhyme saying 'The phoenix comes to nest, the duke is in Gan Hou.

sentences.zh: 鸜鵒入處，公在外野』。」

translations.literal: Phoenix entered dwelling, duke at outside wilds'.'
translations.idiomatic: The phoenix enters the dwelling, the duke is in the wilds outside'."

sentences.zh: 季氏與郈氏鬬雞，季氏芥雞羽，郈氏金距。

translations.literal: Ji clan with Hou clan fought cocks, Ji clan mustard cock feathers, Hou clan gold spurs.
translations.idiomatic: The Ji clan and the Hou clan fought cocks. The Ji clan treated their cock's feathers with mustard. The Hou clan gilded their cock's spurs.

sentences.zh: 季平子怒而侵郈氏，郈昭伯亦怒平子。

translations.literal: Ji Ping Zi angered and attacked Hou clan, Hou Zhao Bo also angered Ping Zi.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Ping Zi became angry and attacked the Hou clan. Hou Zhao Bo also became angry with Ping Zi.

sentences.zh: 臧昭伯之弟會偽讒臧氏，匿季氏，臧昭伯囚季氏人。

translations.literal: Zang Zhao Bo younger brother Hui falsely slandered Zang clan, hid Ji clan, Zang Zhao Bo imprisoned Ji clan people.
translations.idiomatic: Zang Zhao Bo's younger brother Hui falsely slandered the Zang clan and hid with the Ji clan. Zang Zhao Bo imprisoned Ji clan people.

sentences.zh: 季平子怒，囚臧氏老。

translations.literal: Ji Ping Zi angered, imprisoned Zang clan elders.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Ping Zi became angry and imprisoned the Zang clan elders.

sentences.zh: 臧、郈氏以難告昭公。

translations.literal: Zang, Hou clans with difficulties informed Zhao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: The Zang and Hou clans reported the difficulties to Duke Zhao.

sentences.zh: 昭公九月戊戌伐季氏，遂入。

translations.literal: Zhao Gong ninth month wuxu day attacked Ji clan, then entered.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhao, in the ninth month on the wuxu day, attacked the Ji clan and then entered.

sentences.zh: 平子登臺請曰：「君以讒不察臣罪，誅之，請遷沂上。」

translations.literal: Ping Zi ascended tower pleaded said: 'Lord with slander not examined minister crimes, execute me, beg exile Yi Shang.'
translations.idiomatic: Ping Zi ascended the tower and pleaded: "My lord, deceived by slander, does not examine my crimes. Execute me. I request to be exiled to Yi Shang."

sentences.zh: 弗許。

translations.literal: Not permitted it.
translations.idiomatic: He did not permit it.

sentences.zh: 請囚於鄪，弗許。

translations.literal: Requested imprisonment at Bi, not permitted.
translations.idiomatic: He requested imprisonment in Bi. It was not permitted.

sentences.zh: 請以五乘亡，弗許。

translations.literal: Requested with five chariots flee, not permitted.
translations.idiomatic: He requested to flee with five chariots. It was not permitted.

sentences.zh: 子家駒曰：「君其許之。

translations.literal: Zi Jia Ju said: 'Lord should permit it.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Jia Ju said: "My lord should permit it.

sentences.zh: 政自季氏久矣，為徒者眾，眾將合謀。」

translations.literal: Government from Ji clan long, those who follow many, many will unite conspire.'
translations.idiomatic: Government has been with the Ji clan for a long time. Those who follow them are many. The many will unite in conspiracy."

sentences.zh: 弗聽。

translations.literal: Not listened.
translations.idiomatic: He did not listen.

sentences.zh: 郈氏曰：「必殺之。」

translations.literal: Hou clan said: 'Must kill him.'
translations.idiomatic: The Hou clan said: "We must kill him."

sentences.zh: 叔孫氏之臣戾謂其眾曰：「無季氏與有，孰利？」

translations.literal: Shu Sun clan minister Li said to his followers: 'Without Ji clan or with, which beneficial?'
translations.idiomatic: Shu Sun clan's minister Li said to his followers: "Without the Ji clan or with them, which is better?"

sentences.zh: 皆曰：「無季氏是無叔孫氏。」

translations.literal: All said: 'Without Ji clan is without Shu Sun clan.'
translations.idiomatic: All said: "Without the Ji clan is without the Shu Sun clan."

sentences.zh: 戾曰：「然，救季氏！」

translations.literal: Li said: 'Yes, save Ji clan!'
translations.idiomatic: Li said: "Indeed, save the Ji clan!"

sentences.zh: 遂敗公師。

translations.literal: Then defeated duke army.
translations.idiomatic: They then defeated the duke's army.

sentences.zh: 孟懿子聞叔孫氏勝，亦殺郈昭伯。

translations.literal: Meng Yi Zi heard Shu Sun clan won, also killed Hou Zhao Bo.
translations.idiomatic: Meng Yi Zi heard that the Shu Sun clan had won and also killed Hou Zhao Bo.

sentences.zh: 郈昭伯為公使，故孟氏得之。

translations.literal: Hou Zhao Bo was duke envoy, therefore Meng clan got him.
translations.idiomatic: Hou Zhao Bo was on the duke's mission, so the Meng clan got him.

sentences.zh: 三家共伐公，公遂奔。

translations.literal: Three clans together attacked duke, duke then fled.
translations.idiomatic: The three clans jointly attacked the duke. The duke then fled.

sentences.zh: 己亥，公至于齊。

translations.literal: Jihai day, duke arrived at Qi.
translations.idiomatic: On the jihai day, the duke arrived in Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊景公曰：「請致千社待君。」

translations.literal: Qi Jing Gong said: 'Request offer thousand she altars await lord.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing of Qi said: "I request to offer a thousand she altars to await my lord."

sentences.zh: 子家曰：「棄周公之業而臣於齊，可乎？」

translations.literal: Zi Jia said: "To abandon the Duke of Zhou's legacy and serve as minister to Qi, is this permissible?"
translations.idiomatic: Zi Jia said: "To abandon the Duke of Zhou's legacy and serve as minister to Qi—is this permissible?"

sentences.zh: 乃止。

translations.literal: They then stopped.
translations.idiomatic: They then stopped.

sentences.zh: 子家曰：「齊景公無信，不如早之晉。」

translations.literal: Zi Jia said: "Duke Jing of Qi has no trustworthiness. It would be better to go to Jin early."
translations.idiomatic: Zi Jia said: "Duke Jing of Qi cannot be trusted. It would be better to go to the state of Jin early."

sentences.zh: 弗從。

translations.literal: He did not follow this.
translations.idiomatic: He did not follow this advice.

sentences.zh: 叔孫見公還，見平子，平子頓首。

translations.literal: Shu Sun saw the duke return. He saw Ping Zi. Ping Zi bowed his head to the ground.
translations.idiomatic: Shu Sun saw the duke return. When he saw Ping Zi, Ping Zi bowed his head to the ground.

sentences.zh: 初欲迎昭公，孟孫、季孫後悔，乃止。

translations.literal: At first they wished to welcome Duke Zhao. Meng Sun and Ji Sun later regretted it, so they stopped.
translations.idiomatic: At first they wished to welcome Duke Zhao, but Meng Sun and Ji Sun later regretted the decision, so they stopped.

sentences.zh: 二十六年春，齊伐魯，取鄆而居昭公焉。

translations.literal: In the twenty-sixth year, spring, Qi attacked Lu, seized Yun and housed Duke Zhao there.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, in spring, Qi attacked Lu, seized Yun, and housed Duke Zhao there.

sentences.zh: 夏，齊景公將內公，令無受魯賂。

translations.literal: In summer, Duke Jing of Qi was about to restore the duke and ordered not to accept Lu's bribes.
translations.idiomatic: In summer, Duke Jing of Qi was about to restore the duke and ordered that no one accept bribes from Lu.

sentences.zh: 申豐、汝賈許齊臣高龁、子將粟五千庾。

translations.literal: Shen Feng and Ru Jia promised Qi's ministers Gao Que and Zi Jiang five thousand yu of grain.
translations.idiomatic: Shen Feng and Ru Jia promised the Qi ministers Gao Que and Zi Jiang five thousand yu of grain.

sentences.zh: 子將言於齊侯曰：「群臣不能事魯君，有異焉。

translations.literal: Zi Jiang spoke to the Duke of Qi saying: "The ministers are unable to serve the Lu ruler. There is something unusual.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Jiang spoke to the Duke of Qi, saying: "The ministers are unable to serve the Lu ruler. There is something unusual about this.

sentences.zh: 宋元公為魯如晉，求內之，道卒。

translations.literal: Duke Yuan of Song went to Jin on Lu's behalf to seek to restore him. He died en route.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Yuan of Song went to Jin on Lu's behalf to seek to restore him, but he died en route.

sentences.zh: 叔孫昭子求內其君，無病而死。

translations.literal: Shu Sun Zhao Zi sought to restore his lord. He died without illness.
translations.idiomatic: Shu Sun Zhao Zi sought to restore his lord, but he died without any illness.

sentences.zh: 不知天棄魯乎？

translations.literal: I do not know if heaven has abandoned Lu?
translations.idiomatic: I do not know if Heaven has abandoned Lu?

sentences.zh: 抑魯君有罪于鬼神也？

translations.literal: Or if the Lu ruler has offended the spirits?
translations.idiomatic: Or has the Lu ruler offended the spirits and gods?

sentences.zh: 願君且待。」

translations.literal: I wish my lord to wait for now."
translations.idiomatic: I wish my lord to wait for now."

sentences.zh: 齊景公從之。

translations.literal: Duke Jing of Qi followed this.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing of Qi followed this advice.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，昭公如晉，求入。

translations.literal: In the twenty-eighth year, Duke Zhao went to Jin, seeking entry.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, Duke Zhao went to Jin, seeking to be restored.

sentences.zh: 季平子私於晉六卿，六卿受季氏賂，諫晉君，晉君乃止，居昭公乾侯。

translations.literal: Ji Ping Zi had private connections with Jin's six ministers. The six ministers accepted Ji clan bribes, advised the Jin ruler. The Jin ruler then stopped and housed Duke Zhao at Gan Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Ping Zi had private connections with Jin's six ministers. The six ministers accepted bribes from the Ji clan and advised the Jin ruler. The Jin ruler then stopped and housed Duke Zhao at Ganhou.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，昭公如鄆。

translations.literal: In the twenty-ninth year, Duke Zhao went to Yun.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Duke Zhao went to Yun.

sentences.zh: 齊景公使人賜昭公書，自謂「主君」。

translations.literal: Duke Jing of Qi sent someone to bestow a letter on Duke Zhao, calling himself "Sovereign Lord".
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing of Qi sent someone to deliver a letter to Duke Zhao, addressing himself as "Sovereign Lord".

sentences.zh: 昭公恥之，怒而去乾侯。

translations.literal: Duke Zhao was ashamed by this, grew angry and left Gan Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhao was ashamed by this, grew angry, and left Ganhou.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，晉欲內昭公，召季平子。

translations.literal: In the thirty-first year, Jin wished to restore Duke Zhao and summoned Ji Ping Zi.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-first year, Jin wished to restore Duke Zhao and summoned Ji Ping Zi.

sentences.zh: 平子布衣跣行，因六卿謝罪。

translations.literal: Ping Zi went in plain clothes barefoot, through the six ministers to apologize.
translations.idiomatic: Ping Zi went in plain clothes and barefoot, and through the six ministers he apologized.

sentences.zh: 六卿為言曰：「晉欲內昭公，眾不從。」

translations.literal: The six ministers spoke on his behalf saying: "Jin wishes to restore Duke Zhao, but the masses will not follow."
translations.idiomatic: The six ministers spoke on his behalf, saying: "Jin wishes to restore Duke Zhao, but the people will not follow."

sentences.zh: 晉人止。

translations.literal: The Jin people stopped.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin people stopped.

sentences.zh: 三十二年，昭公卒於乾侯。

translations.literal: In the thirty-second year, Duke Zhao died at Gan Hou.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-second year, Duke Zhao died at Ganhou.

sentences.zh: 魯人共立昭公弟宋為君，是為定公。

translations.literal: The people of Lu together established Duke Zhao's younger brother Song as ruler. This is Duke Ding.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Lu together established Duke Zhao's younger brother Song as ruler. This was Duke Ding.

sentences.zh: 定公立，趙簡子問史墨曰：「季氏亡乎？」

translations.literal: After Duke Ding was established, Zhao Jian Zi asked Shi Mo saying: "Will the Ji clan perish?"
translations.idiomatic: After Duke Ding was established, Zhao Jian Zi asked Shi Mo, saying: "Will the Ji clan perish?"

sentences.zh: 史墨對曰：「不亡。

translations.literal: Shi Mo replied saying: "It will not perish.
translations.idiomatic: Shi Mo replied, saying: "It will not perish.

sentences.zh: 季友有大功於魯，受鄪為上卿，至于文子、武子，世增其業。

translations.literal: Ji You had great merit toward Lu, received Meng as chief minister. Down to Wen Zi and Wu Zi, each generation increased their estate.
translations.idiomatic: Ji You had great merit toward Lu and received Meng as the chief minister. Down to Wen Zi and Wu Zi, each generation increased its estate.

sentences.zh: 魯文公卒，東門遂殺適立庶，魯君於是失國政。

translations.literal: When Duke Wen of Lu died, Dong Men Sui killed the legitimate heir and established a concubine's son. The Lu ruler from this point lost control of state affairs.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Wen of Lu died, Dong Men Sui killed the legitimate heir and established a concubine's son. From this point, the Lu ruler lost control of state affairs.

sentences.zh: 政在季氏，於今四君矣。

translations.literal: Government has been with the Ji clan for four rulers now.
translations.idiomatic: Government has been with the Ji clan for four rulers now.

sentences.zh: 民不知君，何以得國！

translations.literal: If the people do not know their ruler, how can he maintain the state!
translations.idiomatic: If the people do not know their ruler, how can he maintain the state!

sentences.zh: 是以為君慎器與名，不可以假人。」

translations.literal: Therefore a ruler must be careful with his vessels and titles; they cannot be lent to others."
translations.idiomatic: Therefore a ruler must be careful with his vessels and titles; they cannot be lent to others."

sentences.zh: 定公五年，季平子卒。

translations.literal: In Duke Ding's fifth year, Ji Ping Zi died.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Ding's fifth year, Ji Ping Zi died.

sentences.zh: 陽虎私怒，囚季桓子，與盟，乃捨之。

translations.literal: Yang Hu was privately angry, imprisoned Ji Huan Zi, made an alliance with him, then released him.
translations.idiomatic: Yang Hu was privately angry, imprisoned Ji Huan Zi, made an alliance with him, and then released him.

sentences.zh: 七年，齊伐我，取鄆，以為魯陽虎邑以從政。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, Qi attacked us, took Yun, and made it Yang Hu's fief in Lu so he could participate in government.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Qi attacked us, took Yun, and made it Yang Hu's fief in Lu so he could participate in government.

sentences.zh: 八年，陽虎欲盡殺三桓適，而更立其所善庶子以代之；

translations.literal: In the eighth year, Yang Hu wished to kill all the Three Huan legitimate heirs and replace them with favored concubine sons;
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Yang Hu wished to kill all the Three Huan legitimate heirs and replace them with favored concubine sons.

sentences.zh: 載季桓子將殺之，桓子詐而得脫。

translations.literal: He loaded Ji Huan Zi into a chariot intending to kill him. Huan Zi deceived him and escaped.
translations.idiomatic: He loaded Ji Huan Zi into a chariot intending to kill him, but Huan Zi deceived him and escaped.

sentences.zh: 三桓共攻陽虎，陽虎居陽關。

translations.literal: The Three Huan jointly attacked Yang Hu. Yang Hu resided at Yang Guan.
translations.idiomatic: The Three Huan jointly attacked Yang Hu. Yang Hu took up residence at Yangguan.

sentences.zh: 九年，魯伐陽虎，陽虎奔齊，已而奔晉趙氏。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, Lu attacked Yang Hu. Yang Hu fled to Qi, then later fled to the Zhao clan in Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Lu attacked Yang Hu. Yang Hu fled to Qi, and then later fled to the Zhao clan in Jin.

sentences.zh: 十年，定公與齊景公會於夾谷，孔子行相事。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, Duke Ding and Duke Jing of Qi met at Jia Gu. Confucius performed the duties of minister.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Duke Ding and Duke Jing of Qi met at Jiagu. Confucius performed the duties of minister.

sentences.zh: 齊欲襲魯君，孔子以禮歷階，誅齊淫樂，齊侯懼，乃止，歸魯侵地而謝過。

translations.literal: Qi wished to attack the Lu ruler by surprise. Confucius used ritual to ascend the stairs, executed the Qi lewd musicians. The Qi lord feared, then stopped, returned Lu's invaded territories and apologized.
translations.idiomatic: Qi wished to attack the Lu ruler by surprise. Confucius used ritual to ascend the stairs and executed the Qi lewd musicians. The Qi lord feared, then stopped, returned Lu's invaded territories, and apologized.

sentences.zh: 十二年，使仲由毀三桓城，收其甲兵。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, he sent Zhong You to destroy the Three Huan city walls and confiscate their weapons and armor.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, he sent Zhong You to destroy the Three Huan city walls and confiscate their weapons and armor.

sentences.zh: 孟氏不肯墮城，伐之，不克而止。

translations.literal: The Meng clan refused to tear down the walls. He attacked them but could not conquer them and stopped.
translations.idiomatic: The Meng clan refused to tear down the walls. He attacked them but could not conquer them and stopped.

sentences.zh: 季桓子受齊女樂，孔子去。

translations.literal: Ji Huan Zi accepted female musicians from Qi. Confucius departed.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Huan Zi accepted female musicians from Qi. Confucius departed.

sentences.zh: 十五年，定公卒，子將立，是為哀公。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, Duke Ding died. His son Jiang succeeded him. This is Duke Ai.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, Duke Ding died. His son Jiang succeeded him. This was Duke Ai.

sentences.zh: 哀公五年，齊景公卒。

translations.literal: In Duke Ai's fifth year, Duke Jing of Qi died.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Ai's fifth year, Duke Jing of Qi died.

sentences.zh: 六年，齊田乞弒其君孺子。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, Qi's Tian Qi assassinated his ruler Ru Zi.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Qi's Tian Qi assassinated his ruler Ru Zi.

sentences.zh: 七年，吳王夫差彊，伐齊，至繒，徵百牢於魯。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, Wu King Fu Chai became strong, attacked Qi, reached Zeng, and demanded one hundred sets of sacrificial animals from Lu.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, King Fuchai of Wu became strong, attacked Qi, reached Zeng, and demanded one hundred sets of sacrificial animals from Lu.

sentences.zh: 季康子使子貢說吳王及太宰嚭，以禮詘之。

translations.literal: Ji Kang Zi sent Zi Gong to persuade King Fu Chai of Wu and Grand Steward Kui, using ritual to make them submit.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Kang Zi sent Zi Gong to persuade the King of Wu, Fuchai, and the Grand Steward Pi, using ritual to make them submit.

sentences.zh: 吳王曰：「我文身，不足責禮。」

translations.literal: The Wu king said: "I am tattooed, not enough to demand ritual from."
translations.idiomatic: The Wu king said: "I am tattooed and not worthy to demand ritual from."

sentences.zh: 乃止。

translations.literal: They then stopped.
translations.idiomatic: They then stopped.

sentences.zh: 吳為鄒伐魯，至城下，盟而去。

translations.literal: Wu on behalf of Zou attacked Lu, reached the city walls, made an alliance and left.
translations.idiomatic: Wu, on behalf of Zou, attacked Lu, reached the city walls, made an alliance, and left.

sentences.zh: 齊伐我，取三邑。

translations.literal: Qi attacked us, taking three towns.
translations.idiomatic: Qi attacked us and took three towns.

sentences.zh: 十年，伐齊南邊。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, they attacked Qi's southern border.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, they attacked Qi's southern border.

sentences.zh: 齊伐魯。

translations.literal: Qi attacked Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Qi attacked Lu.

sentences.zh: 季氏用冉有有功，思孔子，孔子自衛歸魯。

translations.literal: The Ji clan employed Ran You who had merit, thought of Confucius. Confucius returned to Lu from Wei.
translations.idiomatic: The Ji clan employed Ran You, who had merit, and thought of Confucius. Confucius returned to Lu from Wei.

sentences.zh: 齊田常弒其君簡公於俆州。

translations.literal: Qi's Tian Chang assassinated his ruler Duke Jian at Xu Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Qi's Tian Chang assassinated his ruler Duke Jian at Xuzhou.

sentences.zh: 孔子請伐之，哀公不聽。

translations.literal: Confucius requested to attack them. Duke Ai did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius requested to attack them, but Duke Ai did not listen.

sentences.zh: 十五年，使子服景伯、子貢為介，適齊，齊歸我侵地。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, he sent Zi Fu Jing Bo and Zi Gong as envoys to Qi. Qi returned our invaded territories.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, he sent Zi Fu Jing Bo and Zi Gong as envoys to Qi. Qi returned our invaded territories.

sentences.zh: 田常初相，欲親諸侯。

translations.literal: Tian Chang initially as chancellor wished to be close to the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Chang, initially as chancellor, wished to be close to the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 十六年，孔子卒。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Confucius died.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Confucius died.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，越王句踐滅吳王夫差。

translations.literal: In the twenty-second year, Yue King Gou Jian extinguished Wu King Fu Chai.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, King Goujian of Yue destroyed King Fuchai of Wu.

sentences.zh: 二十七年春，季康子卒。

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, spring, Ji Kang Zi died.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, in spring, Ji Kang Zi died.

sentences.zh: 夏，哀公患三桓，將欲因諸侯以劫之，三桓亦患公作難，故君臣多閒。

translations.literal: In summer, Duke Ai was troubled by the Three Huan, intending to use the feudal lords to coerce them. The Three Huan also feared the duke would cause trouble, so ruler and ministers had many estrangements.
translations.idiomatic: In summer, Duke Ai was troubled by the Three Huan and intended to use the feudal lords to coerce them. The Three Huan also feared the duke would cause trouble, so ruler and ministers had many estrangements.

sentences.zh: 公游于陵阪，遇孟武伯於街，曰：「請問余及死乎？」

translations.literal: The duke was strolling at Ling Ban, encountered Meng Wu Bo on the street, said: "May I ask if I will live to see death?"
translations.idiomatic: The duke was strolling at Lingban when he encountered Meng Wu Bo on the street and said: "May I ask if I will live to see death?"

sentences.zh: 對曰：「不知也。」

translations.literal: He replied: "I do not know."
translations.idiomatic: He replied: "I do not know."

sentences.zh: 公欲以越伐三桓。

translations.literal: The duke wished to use Yue to attack the Three Huan.
translations.idiomatic: The duke wished to use Yue to attack the Three Huan.

sentences.zh: 八月，哀公如陘氏。

translations.literal: In the eighth month, Duke Ai went to the Xing clan.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, Duke Ai went to the Xing clan.

sentences.zh: 三桓攻公，公奔于衛，去如鄒，遂如越。

translations.literal: The Three Huan attacked the duke. The duke fled to Wei, then went to Zou, and then to Yue.
translations.idiomatic: The Three Huan attacked the duke. The duke fled to Wei, then went to Zou, and then to Yue.

sentences.zh: 國人迎哀公復歸，卒于有山氏。

translations.literal: The people of the state welcomed Duke Ai back. He died at the You Shan clan.
translations.idiomatic: The people of the state welcomed Duke Ai back. He died at the Youshan clan.

sentences.zh: 子寧立，是為悼公。

translations.literal: Zi Ning succeeded him. This is Duke Dao.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Ning succeeded him. This was Duke Dao.

sentences.zh: 悼公之時，三桓勝，魯如小侯，卑於三桓之家。

translations.literal: During Duke Dao's time, the Three Huan prevailed. Lu was like a small marquess, inferior to the Three Huan families.
translations.idiomatic: During Duke Dao's time, the Three Huan prevailed. Lu was like a small marquess, inferior to the Three Huan families.

sentences.zh: 十三年，三晉滅智伯，分其地有之。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, the Three Jin extinguished Zhi Bo, dividing and possessing his territory.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, the Three Jin destroyed Zhi Bo and divided and possessed his territory.

sentences.zh: 三十七年，悼公卒，子嘉立，是為元公。

translations.literal: In the thirty-seventh year, Duke Dao died. His son Jia succeeded him. This is Duke Yuan.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-seventh year, Duke Dao died. His son Jia succeeded him. This was Duke Yuan.

sentences.zh: 元公二十一年卒，子顯立，是為穆公。

translations.literal: Duke Yuan died in his twenty-first year. His son Xian succeeded him. This is Duke Mu.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Yuan died in the twenty-first year of his reign. His son Xian succeeded him and became Duke Mu.

sentences.zh: 穆公三十三年卒，子奮立，是為共公。

translations.literal: Duke Mu died in his thirty-third year. His son Fen succeeded him. This is Duke Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu died in the thirty-third year of his reign. His son Fen succeeded him and became Duke Gong.

sentences.zh: 共公二十二年卒，子屯立，是為康公。

translations.literal: Duke Gong died in his twenty-second year. His son Tun succeeded him. This is Duke Kang.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Gong died in the twenty-second year of his reign. His son Tun succeeded him and became Duke Kang.

sentences.zh: 康公九年卒，子匽立，是為景公。

translations.literal: Duke Kang died in his ninth year. His son Yi succeeded him. This is Duke Jing.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Kang died in his ninth year. His son Yi succeeded him. This was Duke Jing.

sentences.zh: 景公二十九年卒，子叔立，是為平公。

translations.literal: Duke Jing died in his twenty-ninth year. His son Shu succeeded him. This is Duke Ping.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing died in the twenty-ninth year of his reign. His son Shu succeeded him and became Duke Ping.

sentences.zh: 是時六國皆稱王。

translations.literal: At this time the six states all called themselves kings.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, the six states all called themselves kings.

sentences.zh: 平公十二年，秦惠王卒。

translations.literal: In Duke Ping's twelfth year, Qin's King Hui died.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Ping's twelfth year, King Hui of Qin died.

sentences.zh: 二十（二）年，平公卒，子賈立，是為文公。

translations.literal: In the twenty-second year, Duke Ping died. His son Jia succeeded him. This is Duke Wen.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, Duke Ping died. His son Jia succeeded him. This was Duke Wen.

sentences.zh: 文公（七）［元］年，楚懷王死于秦。

translations.literal: In Duke Wen's first year, Chu's King Huai died in Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Wen's first year, King Huai of Chu died in the state of Qin.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，文公卒，子讎立，是為頃公。

translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, Duke Wen died. His son Qiu succeeded him. This is Duke Qing.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, Duke Wen died. His son Qiu succeeded him. This was Duke Qing.

sentences.zh: 頃公二年，秦拔楚之郢，楚頃王東徙于陳。

translations.literal: In Duke Qing's second year, Qin captured Chu's Ying. Chu's King Qing moved east to Chen.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Qing's second year, the state of Qin captured Chu's Ying. King Qing of Chu moved east to Chen.

sentences.zh: 十九年，楚伐我，取徐州。

translations.literal: In the nineteenth year, Chu attacked us, taking Xu Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, Chu attacked us and took Xuzhou.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，楚考烈王伐滅魯。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, Chu's King Kao Lie attacked and extinguished Lu.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, King Kaolie of Chu attacked and destroyed Lu.

sentences.zh: 頃公亡，遷於下邑，為家人，魯絕祀。

translations.literal: Duke Qing fled, moved to Xia Yi, became a commoner. Lu's sacrifices ceased.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Qing fled, moved to Xiayi, and became a commoner. Lu's sacrifices ceased.

sentences.zh: 頃公卒于柯。

translations.literal: Duke Qing died at Ke.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Qing died at Ke.

sentences.zh: 魯起周公至頃公，凡三十四世。

translations.literal: Lu from the Duke of Zhou to Duke Qing, altogether thirty-four generations.
translations.idiomatic: Lu, from the Duke of Zhou to Duke Qing, had altogether thirty-four generations.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：余聞孔子稱曰「甚矣魯道之衰也！

translations.literal: The Grand Scribe says: I heard Confucius say "How extreme is the decline of the Lu way!
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: I have heard Confucius remark: "How extreme is the decline of the Lu way!

sentences.zh: 洙泗之閒龂龂如也」。

translations.literal: Between the Zhu and Si rivers it was so flourishing."
translations.idiomatic: Between the Zhu and Si rivers it was so flourishing."

sentences.zh: 觀慶父及叔牙閔公之際，何其亂也？

translations.literal: Observe Qing Fu and Shu Ya during Duke Yin's time, how chaotic it was?
translations.idiomatic: Observe Qing Fu and Shu Ya during the time of Duke Min—how chaotic it was!

sentences.zh: 隱桓之事；

translations.literal: Duke Yin and Duke Huan's affairs;
translations.idiomatic: Consider the affairs of Dukes Yin and Huan.

sentences.zh: 襄仲殺適立庶；

translations.literal: Xiang Zhong killed the legitimate heir and established a concubine's son;
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Zhong killed the legitimate heir and established a concubine's son;

sentences.zh: 三家北面為臣，親攻昭公，昭公以奔。

translations.literal: The three houses faced north as ministers, personally attacked Duke Zhao, Duke Zhao fled as a result.
translations.idiomatic: The three houses faced north as ministers, personally attacked Duke Zhao, and Duke Zhao fled as a result.

sentences.zh: 至其揖讓之禮則從矣，而行事何其戾也？

translations.literal: As for their ritual of yielding and offering, they followed it, but their actions, how contrary they were?
translations.idiomatic: As for the ritual of yielding and offering, they followed it, but their actions—how contrary they were!
